description: Hi everyone,Have a One Bedroom One bathroom condo for rental in Warm Springs Fremont location.This 680 sf condo is located on 2nd floor (top floor) and is an end unit. description: SHOWINGS FOR THIS HOME ARE BY APPOINTMENT ONLY.LIMITED APPOINTMENT TIMES ARE AVAILABLE.Please call or textto request an appointment.COMMUNITY:www.edenshoreshoa.orgThere is no community like this in all of San Francisco / Bay Area! - Convenient access to freeway 880 and 92 Bridge (San Mateo Bridge), Dumbarton Bridge, BART and bus lines- Community amenities includes an amazing pool, basketball and tennis courts, three playgrounds, clubhouse, open running trails, and soccer field. - Bus (AC Transit) from and to San Francisco from community- Free community events for residents- Home has a wonderful layout and aestheticsThis luxury home is located in the desirable Eden Shores community of Hayward/Union City. The distinctive floor plan has 5 bedrooms (1 bedroom downstairs), 4.5 bath rooms, 2-car garage, soaring ceiling entry, 9 feet ceilings, formal dining and living room, spacious family room with gas fireplace, and bonus room that can be an office or a study. The large kitchen has custom European cabinets, gas cooktop, microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator, and breakfast bar. The master suite includes a luxurious private bath with two walk-in closets, double sinks & vanities, and separate stall shower. Other amenities include recessed lighting, window coverings, dual-pane windows, central heating, inside laundry room (with washer and dryer), and much more! Private rear yard with room for an organic garden. Walking distance to park, community clubhouse that can be used for parties, basketball courts, tennis courts, swimming pool, playgrounds, running trails, and soccer fields. UPPER FLOOR: One master bedroom en-suite bathroom retreat (dual sink vanity and tub, separate shower) with two walk-in closets; laundry room with washer, dryer, and cabinetry; three large-sized bedrooms (one room with a walk in closet and its own full bathroom!); one full bathroom. LOWER FLOOR: Bright, spacious & open layout with hardwood floors. One bedroom; one full bathroom with shower/bath; kitchen with appliances and European cabinetry; formal dining and formal living room; family room with gas fireplace; breakfast bar kitchen; an office or study room, and professionally landscaped back yard. TWO CAR GARAGE.LARGE BACKYARD with patio area, professionally landscaped. QUALIFICATIONS:- Good credit report- Good rental record- NO smoking or drugs- 12-month lease required- 1 month security deposit- No pets.- Must submit application, rental references, and paycheck stubsClose commuting distance to San Francisco, Berkeley, Foster City, San Mateo, Fremont, San Jose, Pleasanton, Dublin, Redwood City, Burlingame, Newark, Oakland -- close to Costco, Walmart, Target, Whole Foods, Trader Joes, Ranch 99, Luckies groceries and amenities, theater and cinema, shopping center, restaurants & bars and night life.

description: Renters are facing really difficult times right now with very high rent, crazy security deposits, no pets being accepted and landlords want you to have perfect credit and income 3 times or 4 higher than the rent just to allow you to rent their house and pay it off for them. Then they want to increase the rent every time the lease it up and in many cases ask you to move so they can sell the house or move back into it. We can send you all of the program information in writing just by sending a request. it includes all of our licensing information. Most people qualify when they have a 580 or higher credit score and can document your income. We get so many people who worry this is a scam but everything we provide you is verifiable through multiple governmental sources.I have sold homes from Berkeley to Discovery Bay for 27 years. I have managed special financing programs provided by the State and Federal Government that encourage renters to become home owners by providing financing options that don't require perfect credit and in most cases cost less to get into than a rental these days. The financing is 30 year fixed rate and includes property taxes, and all the insurance. Simply put, people who bought homes 15 years ago are still paying the same payment they had originally and you will have the same payment 15 years after you buy the house. Landlords will obviously not be keeping the rent at the same level.In addition there are tax benefits that you get as a homeowner that help most people save thousands per year in Income Tax. This is the part where many people start to think this is a scam or baloney in general. To help with that we offer two things. I am going to give you ways to confirm the information. In addition I can send you an e mail that has both detailed breakdowns on the programs as well as an e mail that has the properties available with pictures and details. The programs that we utilize are FHA, VA, USDA Guaranteed, we also use CHDAP California Housing Down Payment Assistance Program, and CHFA California Housing Finance Agency. These last two programs are state based and provide almost 100% of the down payment you need for the FHA Loan. USDA and VA don't require any down payment. This is just 1 of the homes that are available in San Leandro, Hayward, San Lorenzo and Oakland. THERE IS AN E MAIL LIST AVAILABLE THAT GIVES YOU ALL THE DETAILS OF THE PROGRAM AND THE INSTRUCTIONS TO GET QUALIFIED AS WELL AS PICTURES AND DETAILS OF ALL THE HOUSES. PLEASE TEXT OR E MAIL THE REQUEST WITH YOUR E MAIL ADDRESS SO I CAN SEND THESE TO YOU.This home in San Leandro is 4 bedrooms 2 bathrooms and 1750 square feet. It has a 1 car attached garage and this is all on a lot that is almost 4,000 square feet. There are 50 homes available from $2175-$3400 and the homes are 760-2200 square feet with 1-5 bedrooms. There are also Condominiums and Townhomes that have payments ranging from $1625-$2720 per month with 1-4 bedrooms and 680-1700 square feet. These properties will have a separate Home Owners Association due per month of $200-$430 per month. The cost to move into one of the homes will typically be $3,000-$5,000. Your first payment will not be due until 30 days after you move in.To qualify you must have at least1. A credit score of 580 or higher (credit karma is a place to check if you aren't sure of your credit score)2. You will need to prove your income with the last 30 days paystubs and the last 2 years tax returns3. No Bankruptcy in the last 2 years4. No Short Sale, or Foreclosure in the last 3 years.Licensed by the California Department of Real Estate Eric WexelmanI can respond fastest to texts and e mails as I can't answer calls when I am with my other clients.

description: This cozy, comfortable, very private "Tiny Home/In-Law/Studio" is a detached unit with a gently vaulted roof, and two skylights. It is a back yard studio with a private entrance. The colors are a warm off-white cream with pinewood trim. The canopy covered outdoor patio, accessed through double French Doors, leads out into the sunny backyard, with citrus, peach, and plum trees as well as other green fauna and trees waiting to be planted. We are communal in that we share the backyard areas; good communication is a must, so friendliness and a sense of humor go a long way! Approximately 400 sq feet inside, there is a full sized kitchen that includes a gas stove, dishwasher, refrigerator, microwave, and lots of pantry and cabinet storage. The bathroom has a large shower stall and is fully tiled with a glass block window for plenty of natural light and privacy. The outside patio is tiled and adds an extra 130 sq feet of outdoor living ability.SEMI-FURNISHED with a folding table attached to the wrap-around built-in bookshelves, a queen bed, a hand built redwood bed base with more under bed storage, a small dresser of drawers and a corner shower caddy. If you have a bunch of furniture, this won't work.Located between the Redwood and Laurel districts, this is a quiet street with great neighbors. Even while having quick access to all freeways, easy shopping and restaurants, there is a lot of privacy in this situation and it is very quiet as far as any freeway noise. Just minutes away from the Diamond, Joaquin Miller and Redwood parks, and all the fabulous redwood trails therein, there is quick access to the Colleges of Merritt, Mills and Holy Names.With a short walk to the 35th or MacArthur Avenues, there is a great commute to SF via express bus or carpool, or to catch the main AC bus lines to BART, San Francisco, Berkeley, or downtown Oakland. ïÅ¶	Monthly rental fee is $1600, including utilities(Rent includes these utilities: AT&T Internet, PG&E, EBMUD and WasteManagement) ïÅ¶	MOVE IN is $3200 (first month's rent and 1/2 of Security Deposit).ïÅ¶	Total Security Deposit is $3200; (The second half of the Security Deposit can be paid in incremental amounts over time)ïÅ¶	References, Proof of Income and Credit Report required.ïÅ¶	No section eight	ïÅ¶	No smoking-No illicit drugs ïÅ¶	No extra storage on the property ïÅ¶	Street parking onlyWe want someone who is responsible and pays rent on time. Willingness to set up an electronic bank transfer is essential. Again; references, proof of 3 months of income and current credit report required. No prior evictions.AVAILABLE April 1st, 2016 (possibly earlier)PLEASE NOTE: The pictures here are not all correct as far as furniture (the chairs and the small orange couch..and the cat..are gone...and the outside patio is open now, and the yard is still in fluxuation). We are still processing and cleaning and preparing this unit, but the pictures give an approximate visual idea. Newer pictures will be re-posted as soon as I have them ready. If interested, contact me and tell me about yourself and what you are looking for. We can set up an appointment.

description: Handsome Upper Glenview Craftsman in available March 1st. We would like at least a 6 -12 month commitment, starting March 1. We are most concerned with finding the right folks who will treat our home as if it was theirs (e.g. keeping place nice and being lovely neighbors).We are asking for $3600/month.Gracious home that is the 'best of both worlds' 1920s vintage charm (original hardwood floors, french doors, formal dining room, multi-light windows, wood-burning fireplace), yet is clean and uncluttered with newly renovated bath and kitchen (stainless appliances, instant hot water, gas stove).MBR with his and hers closets. breakfast room/office, parking spot, washer/dryer. Backyard oasis with stone walkways, bbq, lawn, fruit trees, and organic vegetable/flower beds. This is a great neighborhood in upper Glenview (Piedmont side), on a desirable quiet cul-de-sac, wonderful neighbors and pedestrian stairs to Trestle Glen.Easy walk (2 blocks) to Glenview Village (with favorite restaurants - Bellanico, Park Sushi, Marzano, Blackberry Bistro, market with organics, dry cleaner, nail salons, florist, yoga/pilates studios, mail/business store, and other small businesses. Also 3 block walk to Dimond Park (with recreation center, outdoor public pool, and hiking trails along Sausal creek), and transportation (casual carpool and transbay bus).Glenview is a charming, friendly, safe neighborhood, right off 580. 4 minutes from Montclair Village, 7 mins from Grand/Lakeshore. About 10-15 mins to Berkeley and campus, and 20 mins (w/o traffic) to downtown SF. Buses run to SF from Glenview, and there are various BART locations about 10 mins away.*Parking - driveway*Washer and Dryer*Hardwood Floors*Fireplace*Instant hot water*Dishwasher*Garbage Disposal*Ceiling Fans*Gas appliances*Tub/Shower*Pets Negotiable (small, house broken etc.)*Can be rented fully (turn-key) or partially furnished*Required: ID with references, signed sublet agreement, deposit.Available March 1 2016

description: Beautiful, fully-furnished home in Oakland's Dimond District for rent starting April 1st through the end of 2016 and potentially beyond then. The house is a comfortable, bright two-bedroom / one-bath craftsman with a lot of style and charm, perfect for one or two people and that can sleep up to four. The living/dining room has a working fireplace, there are hardwood floors throughout the house, a full bath and shower, a newly-renovated, well-equipped kitchen, complete with a restaurant-grade range and oven, and a large backyard. The kitchen is great for cooks: new appliances, lots of counter space, a six-burner Wolf range, breakfast nook, and a built-in desk/office space that looks out from the kitchen to the backyard. From the kitchen, the back door opens onto a large yard and garden including a sunny patio with a table and chairs, perfect for enjoying an outdoor meal, and a shaded, vine-covered lounge area with couches that is lit with cafe lights at night, excellent for relaxing in the fresh air. The yard also has a charcoal grill, fruit trees, flowers, a lawn, and a resident family of hummingbirds. There is a driveway for off-street parking, a washer/dryer, wifi (included), tv, a great queen-sized bed in the master bedroom, and a very comfortable pull-out sleeper couch in the second bedroom that can sleep two.The house is in Oakland's Dimond District, a few blocks away from Farmer Joe's (a local organic grocery store), Safeway, CVS, Peet's Coffee, La Farine Bakery, other shops and restaurants, a park, library, and public pool. Many East Bay Regional Parks are minutes away. It's not far from Fruitvale Bart station (which is a 20 min Bart ride to SF), and with the 580 and 13 freeways nearby, you can get to UC Berkeley, Mills College, downtown Oakland, and San Francisco quickly.Pets are negotiable.
title: Charming, furnished craftsman for rent April 1st

description: Everyone is searching for a nice apartment that is situated with great access to transportation and freeways. Well this is the apartment you might be looking for. First, the location is with in 5 blocks of Oakland BART, with in 4 Blocks of the newly energized Oakland City Center and China Town. Next Bus transportation is 50 feet away and finally Highway 980 is 5 minutes or less. Affording quick access to SF and the East Bay. Centrally located smack dab in the middle of the east bay with Berkeley a few minutes away. Now for the apartment. High ceiling living room, private entrance, laminate flooring, new gas stove and of course economical gas heating. Granite counter tops with tile kitchen. What is there not to like. Unfortunately not accepting Sec 8 at this time. email or text for viewing. Oh yes, this is not the old Oakland West that you might be thinking of. Oakland West is hot with many SF tech workers finding better rents warmer temperatures in this area yet still with quick commute into the City. Landlord pays for water, sewer and garbage. This is a non smoking unit.
title: Outstanding City center location 2 Br 1 Ba Apt

description: 589 9th St .Oakland, CA 94607$2,600 to $3000/mo. 780 s.f. One bedroom condo with a private own patio. facing to a beautiful courtyard.you have one security car parking in garage level. KEY FEATURESYear Built: 2009Sq Footage: 780 sqft. including a private own patio. Facing to a beautiful courtyard.Bedrooms: 1 BedBathrooms: 1 BathParking: 1 Garage.Private patio: 1 private own patio. Lease Duration: 1 Year (See Details Below)Deposit: $3,000.Pets Policy: No Pets Allowed. Non smoker. Laundry: In UnitProperty Type: CondoDESCRIPTIONSunny condo unit in luxury amenity building completed in 2009!Located near historic Old Oakland, Market Square offers style, luxury, comfort and convenience. This sunny 1 bedroom/1 bath condo has large windows and gorgeous finishes throughout, and access to the building's amenities such as fitness center, sauna/steam room and business center! Conveniently located near Old Oakland's restored Victorian buildings which houses shops, galleries and restaurants. Old Oakland hosts a weekly bountiful Farmer's Market filled with fresh produce, flowers, baked good and prepared foods. Market Square has easy access to 980/880/580/80, Berkeley, Emeryville, Bay Bridge, SF, BART - 3 blocks away (12th Street/City Center station and 14 minute ride to Downtown San Francisco) and all modes of public transportation. For more information/private showing call or e-mail:Tenant must have income of 3 times monthly rent and minimum credit score of 750. It's better for one single person. Must be clean and neat and keep the place clean or Tenant must hire a housekeeper once a month to clean this unit to keep it clean and neat.

description: CABIN IN WOODSartistic, poetic, funky, unique.The cabin is a large studio with apprx. 550 sq ft. a small balcony overlooks the canyon of Sausal Creek, and its winter creek. The living area has french doors leading to the balcony as well as a wall of windows through which the acacias and oak trees are visible. Off the living area is the kitchen with cement counter tops and a gas stove and full size refrigerator with lower freezer compartment. To the right of the entry is a small hallway leading to a walk in closet and tiled bathroom with redwood shower stall. The floor is a composite wood shearing material (OSB)... Parking is off-street and an on-site laundry room.The cabin is located behind a brown shingle duplex 4674 Dolores Ave. Oakland 94602. Face the duplex and walk down the driveway on the left and through a wooden gate, continue down the path to cabin. Dolores is a quiet street one block long which intersects Park Blvd. Park Blvd has direct bus lines to SF and informal commute stops as well as transport to downtown Oakland and Berkeley. A short walk to Glenview Shopping Center (coffee bar, restaurants, grocery store, dentist, etc) Close to Montclair Golf Course and Driving Range. Walk to Dimond Recreation Center and Lions Pool -- year round out-door heated pool . Close to Farmer Joes and Montclair Shopping area for major grocery and retail stores. Minutes from the Park exit off either Hwy 13 coming from Berkeley and Walnut Creek and the 580 Freeway from S.F. or OaklandViewings this weekend March 12 Saturday from 1-4 pm and March 13 Sunday (remember Daylight Savings) 1-4pm. Additional viewing can be arranged next week during weekdays if you email me and give me some time to arrange. Available on April 15 (perhaps before). Please email me for questions but if the information is contained in this ad I wont answer so read whole ad before emailing, Dogs and cats Ok. Do not walk around the property or disturb other tenants, just remember to walk down the driveway through the wood gate on the path which leads to the cabin. Stay in this area only. Thanks. uded my email in ad text. You can email me at luckymollin at ya hoo . com to arrange additional viewings or ask questions not answered in ad. Thank you!
title: CABIN IN WOODS Pets OK! Private, Quiet and lots of Charm

description: *******AVAILABLE NOW 2016******* *~*~*~*~*~*The innovative residences at The Packard Lofts allow you to experience Downtown/Uptown living in Oakland to its absolute fullest. Distinctive live/work loft floor plans provide a unique space to call your own. This gorgeous loft is located in the heart of Downtown/Uptown Oakland. Find all of the great shops, theatres and entertainment, dining and nightlife, cultural events and Farmer's Markets that Oakland has to offer right outside your door! We are conveniently located on Broadway near the 19th Street BART Station, directly across the street from the YMCA, above Sweet Bar Bakery & Two Jack's Denim, and just five blocks from the lovely Lake Merritt. Just a short walk to Whole Foods, the Fox and Paramount Theatres, Grand Avenue shops, 24-Hour Fitness, Truve Fitness, the Hive and much more! We are also one block from Luka's Taproom, Plum Bar, MUA, Drake's Brewery, Calavera, Pican Southern Cuisine and Ozumo Sushi & Sake Lounge the list goes on and on. Our spectacular rooftop deck overlooks the beautiful scenery of the Bay Area, with views of the Oakland and Berkeley Hills and Bay Bridge! Why wouldn't you want to call this place home!?! *~*~*~*~*~**~*Packard Lofts has an on-site manager, an on-site laundry facility, a secure building and one reserved parking space included in our gated garage. Please view our website for floor plans and images at www.packardloftsoakland.com Unit #405 (refer to floor plan 05 on our website)*~* *~*~*~*Open style (NO ROOM HUGE OPEN SPACE) way to bring out your creative side! *~*Dramatic 16ft. ceilings *~*~*~*Expansive 10 ft. windows (window coverings included) street views of of Oakland and Berkeley Hills *~*Granite counters in kitchen and bathrooms *~*~*~*Maple Cabinets with under-lighting *~*Modern kitchen with refrigerator, glass top oven, microwave, dishwasher and garbage disposal*~*~*~*Concrete floors throughout unit *~*One FREE parking spot in our secure on-site garage SORRY NO SUV'S *~*~*~*Water, garbage, and internet paid by owner *~*Cat friendly *~*~*~*881 SQ. FT. ($2850 LARGE LOFTApplicants must agree to: *~*Full credit check *Employment verification *~*Prior rental reference check *~*~*~*~*~*Please contact Barbara Turner atto schedule a private showing or stop by our Open House February 28th 11am-2pm*~*~*~*~*~*

description: Available May 15, 2015. High ceilings/top floor! $2650/month ($2,850 couple) including water and garbage. Wifi, cable, electricity, and enclosed parking additional. Nine month minimum. Prefer at least one year; long-term residency desired.Rent my roomy, furnished sunny one-bedroom modern condo (about 80 sq. meters or 900 sq. ft. w/ covered balcony). On top floor (4th) of redecorated building with elevator. 15-foot-high ceiling in living/dining room; breakfast counter/bar; computer area (with modern workforceÂ® computer desk, cabinet storage, counter space); wall-to-wall carpeting and parquet kitchen/hall floors; large closet; full-sized newer washer and dryer IN UNIT, large new stainless steel refrigerator, dishwasher; garbage disposal; microwave; bathroom with tub/shower. Wood-burning fireplace. Living room opens onto skylight-covered private balcony with view to the park for al fresco dining.Apartment furnishings include queen-sized bed, dresser, kitchen utensils, dishes, pots and pans, linens. Queen futon couch, two comfy easy chairs and ottoman, TV, DVD & VCR players, desk, solid maple dining room table and chairs. Overstuffed upholstered chairs [shown] and futon [shown] and larger computer desk recently replaced the vintage bamboo and wicker furniture in some photos. Roof deck with 360Â° views, great for sun-worshippers or stargazing. This is in addition to your private view balcony with umbrella, table and chairs and lush plants. This desirable Adams Point condo is across from lovely Lake Merritt in Oakland, just off Grand Ave., walking distance to 19th St. BART station and Grand/Lakeshore shopping district including Arizmendi Bakery, coffeehouses (Peet's, Starbucks), beautiful Whole Foods (walking distance), Trader Joe's, Noah's bagels, fine restaurants and cafes; Rockridge and Piedmont Ave. shopping and recreation minutes away by car or bike. Sunday farmer's market at Jack London Square, or Saturday's in neighborhood -- and then there's always Chinatown restaurants and markets. Walking distance or short drive to the hip new Uptown District's trendy restaurants, bars and art galleries. You'll love my neighborhood!Short commute to San Francisco, Emeryville, Berkeley (UC) or Mills College; 15 minute walk to downtown Oakland 19th St. BART. Rent includes garbage and water. One reserved parking space in secure garage in building available. Cable ready. ($2975 One person all-inclusive includes Wifi, cable, electricity allowance, local phone and parking.) Move-out cleaning fee of $75 and security deposit required.Please E-mail with your DATES, PERSONAL INFORMATION and PHONE NUMBER for call back.BUT -- VERY IMPORTANT: FIRST Please tell me a little about yourself as the most important thing is that you are responsible, dependable, and quiet, and will respect my condo and neighbors. Where do you work? Where do you live now and why do you want a sublet, etc.? I need to know about you and then talk to you before I will schedule an appointment or confirm. Thank you!

description: Hi there!A beautiful, spacious "studio-style" unit is now available on the private, first floor of a quiet, luxury home. The home is a brand new, gorgeously remodeled 1880's Victorian. The private, "studio-style" space includes one bedroom, living room, home office (or guest bedroom) and washer dryer as the first floor unit with private entrance. Total 770 square feet of space. Bathroom and kitchen is right up the steps. Three awesome housemates live on the second floor. About housemates, 25-30 year old grad students and working professionals:S: Marketing and communications consultant. Works in Downtown Oakland. Loves writing, cooking and volunteering for the neighborhood community garden.A: PhD student at Berkeley. Fun, loving, open person who loves frequent travel to China for research.Z: Working professional in environmental campaigning. Loves the outdoors, yoga and chilling in SF.Beautiful, quiet neighborhood with lovely neighbors and a treasured community garden down the block that provides fresh, gourmet breakfast every morning. Easy BART access to downtown Oakland, SF and Emeryville. 3-6 month lease ok. 1 year lease preferred.Prefer single person, who is okay with one dog in the house.Address is 1677 11th Street. Please email me to schedule a time to come by!

description: I am looking for an awesome roommate in a 2 Bed/1Bath apartment located close from the Lake Merritt. The room is available for March 1st (negotiable). About the apartment : - Lower level- Very spacious : 1500 square feet - Furnished- Spacious living room with hardwood flooring and a dining area - Eat-in Kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, oven and plenty of storage- Private laundry room (washing and drying machine) inside the apartment with room for storage- 1 Bathroom recently remodeled with 2 sinks, a bathtub About your room : - private - 175 square feet- unfurnished - closetAbout the Location: - Adams Point- Private parking negotiable - Direct access to the freeway- 10min walking from the Lake Merritt- 10 min walking from Grand Avenue (Restaurants, Grand Lake Theater, cafes, Traders Joe. . .)- 10min biking from Bart stationAbout the rent : Monthly Rent : $1250. (Rent control. Insane and sudden raise is not an option.)Monthly Amenities : $250 (ALL INCLUDED : Internet, Cable, PGE, Water, Garbage)(A slight adjustment might be asked for PGE during the winter)Total : $1500 due on the 1st of each monthDeposit : $1250ME : I am a 30 years old F. I am French and I work full time in Berkeley. I love playing/watching sports and movie nights.YOU : - You will need to be dog friendly as an adorable Westie is also living in the apartment. - No couple. - Overnight guest ok with per-warning. Small occasional get together OK. - Communication very important- No smoking or any drugs inside the apartment- Respectful of the common spaces (aka : don't forget to clean after yourself)If you are interested and want a tour, contact me directly via email with a brief description of yourself : name, age, gender, occupation and other useful information. Reply within 2 hours guarantee.

description: Located in the up-and-coming West Oakland Arts and Crafts District, this 1907 vintage, TWO-bedroom/one bath, UPSTAIRS apartment offers nine-foot high ceilings, BRAND NEW fresh white paint and wall-to-wall, BRAND NEW short-pile, industrial taupe carpeting. It is in a freestanding building with four identical two-bedroom apartments, two upstairs and two downstairs. Street parking is easy and ample. (IF YOU SEE THIS POSTING, THE APARTMENT IS STILL AVAILABLE. IT WILL NOT BE RENTED UNTIL THE CONCLUSION OF THE OPEN-HOUSE ON SUNDAY, MARCH 6, FROM 11:00AM-1:00 PM ------ I'M SORRY, I AM NOT AVAILABLE TO SHOW THE UNIT BEFORE THE OPEN-HOUSE ON SUNDAY) We've completely renovated the kitchen with a BRAND NEW refrigerator, BRAND-NEW over-the-stove microwave, BRAND NEW kitchen cabinets and BRAND NEW kitchen sink and faucet. The bathroom has also been COMPLETELY RENOVATED with a BRAND NEW toilet, BRAND NEW bathtub/shower, and BRAND NEW European-style bathroom sink fixture. The bathroom also offers BRAND NEW cabinets and BRAND NEW floor tile. There is a nice laundry room on the premises with a coin-op washer and dryer. There is a cute, beautifully landscaped backyard with a patio for hanging out, BBQing or entertaining. Each of the four units also gets it's own weather-tight outdoor storage locker, located in the backyard. The yard is completely enclosed and fenced to keep intruders out and pets from wandering off. It is a pooch paradise! There is a redwood community table that seats up to 10 for a dinner party. . . If you like to garden, there is an area for you to plant vegetables or flowers...Located just off West Grand Ave. near Adeline, this building is literally a five-minute, straight-shot drive to the Bay Bridge tollbooth!!! It's a five-minute drive to 880 and 580 onramps. 10 minutes to Emeryville, Berkeley or Downtown Oakland. Ten minutes to Ikea, Trader Joe's, Safeway Pak-And-Save, Nordstrom Rack, Bay Street Mall, Home Depot, Lanesplitter Pizza, Target, Best Buy! Very central and convenient... The neighborhood is mixed-use with lofts, warehouses, art-spaces and various industrial workshops, etc. There are also lots of old Victorian houses in various stages of rehab, some gorgeous and some run-down. There is a new charter school (Vincent Academy) 1/2 block away. Crime in this neighborhood is mostly a thing of the past, with West Oakland's serious revitalization program underway. New development and creative people are flooding in from Berkeley and San Francisco and have turned this area into a neighborhood for artists, musicians and craftspersons. However it IS an urban neighborhood and can get very noisy sometimes... It's not Piedmont! Locals are sometimes hanging out on the corner, socializing and playing music. It can be like Mardi Gras at times. If you crave quiet and serenity, this may not be the neighborhood for you. It is a VERY friendly neighborhood, but can sometimes be noisy in the daytimes.The building has a security fence around the perimeter, a security gate at the front entry door and each of the four apartment doors are individually gated, so tenants are SUPER SAFE. We have never had a break-in, or any problem with crime in this building. Nobody has ever been hassled in the 8 years I've owned this building. The neighbors are nice.A cat or nice dog MAY be OK with a reasonable pet deposit. (Deposit amount dependent on the pet) The apartment rent is $1800/month. SORRY, NO SECTION 8 ACCEPTED. $1800 refundable security deposit to move in. One UPSTAIRS apartment is available NOW! Tenant pays PGE gas and electric. Owner pays water and trash. I'll be showing the apartment SUNDAY, March 6, FROM 11:00am - 1:00PMPlease come by during those hours to view the place and meet me... The address is 1084 24th St. Oakland CA 94607. (Major cross-streets are West Grand and Adeline) Applications will be available at the time of the showing, or you may bring a renters resume. Pay stubs and/or credit reports are also welcome, but not mandatory for consideration.THANKSjeff

description: MODERN AND SPACIOUS WEST END COMMONS LOFT-STYLE TOWNHOMEBuilding: West End CommonsNeighborhood: ClausenBedrooms: 1 BR + DenBathrooms: 1 BAStyle: TownhouseParking: DeededSquare Feet: 965Security Deposit: 1.5 MonthsLease Term: 1 YearMust Provide Credit Report and Income/Employment Verification, Good Credit RequiredThis 2-level detached townhouse has no shared walls and no neighbors above or below. High ceiling heights, modern architectural elements, and expansive windows and skylight give this 1 bedroom plus den, 1 bathroom unit, an abundance of natural light.This loft-style home is spacious, with an open living, dining, and work space. A beautiful open kitchen offers granite countertops, bamboo cabinetry, and top-of-the-line stainless steel Bosch appliances including a refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, gas oven/range, Nest Thermostat, and garbage disposal. The straight staircase leads to the spacious second floor with one bedroom, a large walk-in closet, a den, and a good-sized bathroom with 2 wall-mounted Duravit sinks + custom built vanities, a tiled shower/bathtub, and high-grade lighting fixtures.Designed by the award-winning firm David Baker + Partners, the individual townhouses at West End Commons combine the functional and stylish aspects of a loft with more traditional aspects of home design. Large open floor plans are paired with well-appointed kitchens and bathrooms as well as more secluded sleeping areas on the upper floors. Each of the townhouses opens on to 1 of 5 lanes. Lined with pavers, lit by streetlights, and landscaped with trees, vines, and grasses, the lanes create an intimate retreat that was inspired by classic urban neighborhoods such as Brooklyn Heights, London's Islington, and Boston's North End. A path leading through shared green space provides an inviting place to wander or meet up with friends, neighbors, or clients.Located in Oakland's West Clawson neighborhood just 2 blocks south of Emeryville, the development has easy access to all of Emeryville's shops, eateries, grocery stores, and entertainment.Unit Features:â€¢ 1 bedroom plus den, 1 bathroom bi-level detached townhouseâ€¢ 965 sq. ft. â€¢ High ceilingsâ€¢ Kitchen features stainless steel Bosch appliancesâ€¢ Polished concrete floors on first floor, carpet on second floorâ€¢ Bathroom with Duravit sinks, subway tiled shower/bathtub, and high-grade lighting fixturesâ€¢ Track lightingâ€¢ Stackable Bosch washer/dryer in unitâ€¢ Central heat and tankless water heaterâ€¢ Secure parking space right in front of unitâ€¢ Pets will be considered on an individual basisComplex Features:â€¢ Controlled-access intercom/telephone entry systemâ€¢ Beautifully landscaped including small green park with picnic tableâ€¢ San Francisco Bay Trail soon to open right in front of complex, connecting you to a variety of hiking, bikin,g and jogging paths that will stretch for 400 miles throughout the Bay Areaâ€¢ Close to Brown Sugar Kitchen and Kilovolt Coffeeâ€¢ Easy access to Bay Bridge, Downtown Oakland BART, Jack London Square, Rockridge, Berkeley, and all major freewaysâ€¢ Short walk to EmeryGoRound Free Shuttle w/ Service to BART, Bay Street Shopping and Emeryville Marina / AC Transit

description: Great student housing, close to UC Berkeley, College of Arts and Crafts, as well as many other colleges.This Upper Piedmont house has three bedrooms, plus, two & 1/2 baths, kitchen, formal dining room, den, and hardwood floors. Downstairs there's a large laundry room with a separate wine and/or workshop room, and an enclosed 1 car garage.From the back upper deck you can see a panoramic view of the Golden Gate, Bay, and San Mateo Bridges, downtown SF, Marin County, San Mateo County, and Emeryville. The lower deck looks onto the back yard.In front there is a hedged in outdoor patio, and in the back there is a small lawn and the upper and a lower decks are Great for enjoying the views and entertaining.This house is located very close to the elementary, middle, and high schools, all are some of the most highly desirable and high quality schools in the area (and some say some of the top primary and secondary schools that exist across the nation).Rent is only 5,500 / monthAgent cooperation.To arrange a viewing callor
title: Upper Piedmont House With A Panoramic Bay Area View

description: Newly remodeled 2 Bedroom and 2 Bathroom unit available now! Enjoy this spacious home that boasts a grand backyard serving as a green oasis with a bountiful avocado tree.The home is in the highly-sought after North Oakland, Berkeley, Emeryville (NOBE) area. It's a commuter's location since it's a short 2 blocks from the MacArthur Bart and just minutes away from the I-580 and I-880 highways. Walkscore - 79, Bikescore - 90, Transitscore - 73Location & Community Details- Close to cafes, local eateries, and they're all walking distance- Easy access to SF & Silicon Valley (580, 80 & 24- Free Emery Bus Shuttle to BART within walking distance (few blocks)- Close to Bay Street Shopping & IKEAAbout the Unit- New Stainless Steel Appliances including a new W/D- Granite Counter Tops- New flooring, lighting, blinds, fixtures throughout the bedrooms and bathrooms- Private Entrance and Exit-way- Dedicated Parking and Off-street Parking- Gated, spacious Backyard that you can make your own- Minutes to BartAbout You- Section 8 is NOT considered for this property- Minimum credit score of 670- Responsible, clean, and professional with rental/housing references (2 adults preferred, but no more than 4 to the unit; family okay)- Can show proof of income and submit to background/criminal investigation; LinkedIn profiles welcome- Pet-free, smoke-free, and drug-free- No subletting- Able to sign at least 12-month lease - Able to provide security deposit (equivalent to rent) + first months rent (upon moving in)Details- 2 Bedrooms / 2 Bathrooms (1 Master Bedroom w/ En Suite Bathroom)- Sq Ft - ~1,000 sq ftRental Terms- Rent: $3,550- Garbage included. Tenant(s) pay utilities, gas, electric, and water. - Duration: 13 months (longer duration available)- Available: March 14, 2016- Application Fee: $40- Security Deposit: $3,550- Move-in: Application, First Month's Rent, and Security Deposit

description: 1121 - 40th Street Unit 4205, EmeryvilleRental Rates continue rising in SF. Come to sunny Emeryville!!!Andante Condominiums1121 40th Street, EmeryvilleABOUT THE UNITThis unit is located on the 2nd floor facing adaline st and garden. Very well detailed unit with 1 bedroom and 1 full bath. Bright, airy open kitchen and dining room combination with living room area and deck. Excellent exposure to afternoon summer sun. All modern stainless appliance upgrades too. Includes dishwasher, granite countertop, refrigerator, microwave, wood floor, carpet. Parking space included. Approximately 625 square foot unit.ABOUT THE LOCATIONAndante is located at a premiere corner of Emeryville, at the intersection of San Pablo Ave, 40th and Adeline Streets. Andante is close to Bay Area transportation, Bay Bridge, University of California Berkeley, downtown Oakland, walking distance to many Emeryville's jobs, including Chiron and Pixar Studios. Excellent public transportation to BART, AC Transit to downtown Oakland and San Francisco.ABOUT THE BUILDINGThe Andante is a 125-unit condominium development on 1.83 acres of land in the heart of Emeryville. It is located on the site of the King Midas Card Club, which closed in 1998.This mixed-use building was designed by HDO Architect Planners, developed by SNK Development and completed in 2005. Amenities include gated secured entry, a fitness center, spa, elevators to all residential levels, private open space/courtyard with seating area and parking for 263 cars. There is 15,000 square feet of ground floor commercial space consisting of restaurants and retail stores.One- bedroom floor plans at the Andante include sound-controlled walls and floors, granite countertops, laminated wood flooring in the entry and kitchen, ceramic tile flooring in the bathroom, birch and cherry laminated cabinets with satin chrome pulls and an 8-inch-deep dual stainless steel sink. Unit offers upgraded plumbing fixtures, including a Kohler pull-spray kitchen faucet, walk-in closets with shelving, private outdoor space and abundant natural light.For more information, contact Fred Vaghar athttp://www.andanteemeryville.com for more pics!This contemporary condo offers outstanding location in Emeryville's most desirable location. Located on the corner of 40th & San Pablo off Adeline St. This sophisticated unit features the following amenities:* Excellent commute location - just minutes from SF & most bay area cities* 1 bedroom with walk-in closet, 9 foot ceilings, plush carpet & upgraded laminate wood flooring* Second Level unit with natural sunlight on both sides of the unit* Elevator in building from parking garage.* Gated community with manicured gardens, & pass card entry.* Full bathroom with large soaking tub, granite counters, mirrored vanity, and ceramic tile floors* Light filled living room with direct access to outdoor deck via sliding glass door.* Upgraded kitchen with newer stainless steel appliances including electric range, refridgerator, microwave and dishwasher. Granite countertops and custom cherry cabinets with brush nickel hardware.* Custom built-in work stations * Full size washer and dryer in unit.* Exclusive parking for 1 car in secure garage, secured public parking available for guests.* Gym and Fitness center* One year lease preferred* Internet and all utilities are included.
title: Contemporary/Urban One Bedroom Condo, 'Andante' Emeryville

description: in this 851 sq. ft. 1 bedroom condo at Watergate, Emeryville's premiere resort condominium community. It's a commuter's dream just 15 minutes from SF, 10 minutes from UC Berkeley.Upgrades include  The large dining room will accommodate a good sized dining room set and the spacious bedroom has two large closets with mirror doors that bounce back the water view. This extraordinary condo is located  with one of the year round heated swimming pools with an indoor entrance, an indoor spa and a coed sauna as well as ping pong and racquetball courts. description: Life on a boat is a very peaceful experience, but you are also centered next to everything here. It is truly the best of both worlds. You have complete access to Oakland, Berkeley, and SF with the serenity of a park-like atmosphere. The Marina has picnic and BBQ areas for you to enjoy year round.When you are not enjoying the spectacular views of the bay, enjoy touring around Oakland, Berkeley and San Francisco! There is also a kitchenette with a hotplate skillet, toaster oven, refrigerator, microwave, electric water kettle, and hand pumped water. Elegant lighting and curtains give a cozy feel in your home away from home. There is a twin sized bed and functioning toilet. On the back deck there is a small Weber gas grill.Private bath house and laundry facility with wifi and tv on the premises.I will respect your privacy, but I am on call if you need anythingLocation, Location, Location! This place is magical. The views of the Golden Gate Bridge and the skyline of San Francisco at sunset are breathtaking. People come here just to take photos at sunset. Emeryville is the center of the bay. There is an outdoor mall and shopping center within walking distance, and there is also a FREE SHUTTLE that will take you to these places. The mall has everything from the Apple Store to Old Navy and an AMC theater. Guitar Center, Trader Joe's and Bev Mo are just around the corner as well. If you want to get into the city of San Francisco, we are located right across the bay and have what I call a private driveway into the city, as the on ramp to the Bay Bridge is just at the end of the marina.Public transit is free! The Emery-go-Round is a shuttle that comes every 15 minutes and will take you to the local shops and BART.The wifi is spotty. It works ok, but I use a range extending antenna and that gives me no problems. Amped wireless is the brand name.You have complete access to all parts of the boat, however, I do ask that you refrain from operating any valves, rigging, or the motor.I only ask that you respect the boat and all her inner workings. The toilet is does not accept solid waste, but there is a Private Bath house with large showers and a laundry room with a TV and WiFi. This is a private marina so please respect the guests and residents here by keeping down the noise levels. Also, you will need access keys that I will provide. You will be responsible for lost keys at the rate of $100 per key. Thank you. Happy House Hunting!

description: Nature is whispering in your ears. A rare woodland retreat! Don't miss this rare opportunity to reside in a truly classic Montclair home!Dog ok up to 25lbs. Pet insurance required. Owner will approve breed, not agent. References needed (from pet hospital too).Brief Description:Discover this inspiring Mediterranean style Montclair home located high in the prestigious Montclair District in the Oakland Hills. Built in 1993. Discover this inspiring Mediterranean style Montclair home located high in the prestigious Montclair District in the Oakland Hills. Built in 1993, this comfortable two-story in-law unit is one bedroom, one bath with private entrance wonderful garden area and a view looking directly to San Francisco. Gardens private tranquil forested setting.While this house offers the one-of-a-kind charm of an authentic Mediterranean style Montclair home -- complete with authentic architectural details -- modern updates throughout balance ease of living for today's lifestyle. The layout and functionality are perfect: tall vaulted entry, Spanish tile floors and carpeting, a large living room with high ceiling and corner room windows, space-saver, modern kitchen, provide excellent flow throughout the living areas across two levels. Sunny second floor bedroom and large bath on the the main level. The upstairs bedroom with private deck and bay view is accessible through a spiral staircase!Old style plaster interior walls give this home a cozy woodland feel. There is a sophisticated warmth about this in-law apartment.Owner pays utilities, trash and gardening. Application fee is $30 per adult (18+). Credit score must be 700 plus.Neighborhood and Vicinity:Yes, location is everything. The East Bay Regional Parks Lake Temescal open space area is within walking distance. The Hills Swim and Tennis Club are moments away on Thornhill Drive. Shopping and dining in Montclair Village is just down Mountain Blvd. You won't want to miss nearby Montclair Village, only a mile away, with its abundance of restaurants, boutique stores, design galleries, ice cream and coffee shops. There are bakeries, retail shopping, two supermarkets, and a host of other chow providers very nearby as well.Nearby, the Temescal and Tilden Regional Recreation areas offer hiking and swimming. Enjoy Lake Temescal with its sweet beach, walking paths and fishing spots. We are within minutes of many other amazing hiking, biking, and riding trails and parks.This home is less than five miles from UC Berkeley. PIXAR, Bayer, Kaiser Hospital, Summitt Hospital and Alta Bates Hospital are all within an easy drive. Downtown Berkeley and Oakland are 10-15 minutes close by. There is excellent transit availability on Broadway Terrace and Mountain Blvd. Commuters will appreciate the easy access to the Rockridge BART station.This location is also ideal if you'd like to visit the Oakland Rose Garden or the Sculpture Gardens Jack London Square, the University of California, Berkeley, or Silicon Valley. Downtown Oakland has some of the best restaurants in California, not to mention a downtown lake, complete with gondolas and a running path.For baseball fans, the SF Giants are 25 minutes away by car, BART, or Ferry. The Ferry drops you off at Center Field before the game and picks you up 20 min. after. The Oakland Coliseum, home of the fabulous Oakland Athletics, is 20 min away by car or BART. Street parking is free and ample.Getting Around:San Francisco is only 20 minutes away, Muir Woods a quick 45 minute drive, and the wineries of Napa and Sonoma are an hour away. We are 20 minutes from Oakland airport and 35 minutes from SFO. BART, with a station just 1.5 miles away, goes into downtown Oakland and San Francisco, as well as to both airports. The ferry system, a more scenic mode of transportation, goes from Jack London Square to San Francisco, Marin, or Angel Island. From the Ferry Station in SF, you can get a boat to Alcatraz Island, one of the most famous prisons in the world. It makes for a wonderful day trip.Don't miss this rare opportunity to reside in a truly classic Montclair home!Highlightsâ€¢	Private woodland retreat in the Montclair hills.â€¢	Available partly furnishedâ€¢	Located on a large tranquil forested lot.â€¢	Spanish tile and carpet throughout.â€¢	Large sunny living room with corner garden view windows.â€¢	One bedroom upstairs via spiral staircase. 1 bath on main level.â€¢	Kitchen with tile floor, modern cabinetry, solid countertop, gas range top, microwave, refrigerator, stainless sink, modern lighting.â€¢	Abundance of natural light.â€¢	Soft tone neutral paint colors.â€¢	Excellent off-street parking.â€¢	Utilities paid by owner, gardening and garbage paid by ownerâ€¢	Asking rent $2200 monthlyâ€¢	Security deposit $2500â€¢ No pets/animalsâ€¢ Contact broker/property mgr, Frank Hennefer,BRE 00852682â€¢ Shown by appt only. Please Do Not Disturb Occupants.
title: Custom Built Home In Montclair Community

description: https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=zaby4TO8AqUY.kK5QINPCDDg4&usp=sharingwhen we were looking for a place we initially wanted to be on a main street.. piedmont, grand, college (both berkeley and oakland), bay st, fourth st, university, you get the idea. . . but we couldn't figure out which... and we didn't know what that would mean for parking... and we weren't sure how close that would put us to highways if we need to leave town :) so... we wrote down every place we like in the east bay... Including. . . http://www.4thstreetshop.com/ shopping outdoors http://www.sfgate.com/traveler/guide/eastbay/neighborhoods/piedmont.shtml restaurants & independent movies http://www.baystreetemeryville.com/ commercial/mall like & mainstream movies http://www.shattuckshop.com/ decent coffee shops and various ethnic foods http://www.sfgate.com/traveler/guide/eastbay/neighborhoods/grand.shtml a lake, a farmers market, a theatre, delis, bakeries, and both starbucks for her, petes for me http://www.shopparkstreet.com/ a little further out in alameda, a longer stretch that used to be trees and is now everything else http://www.oaklandchinatownchamber.org/visitor/about_chinatown.html smaller, but more authentic then sf chinatown http://jacklondonsquare.com/ shopping, dining, jazz, waterfront and PUT IT ON A MAP... Just like this... https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=zaby4TO8AqUY.kK5QINPCDDg4&usp=sharingand then we picked the center of it all... ADELINE ST, EMERYVILLE And 80, 580, 880, 980, 24, 13, etc are all very very accessible... so now we're close to everything we want, we can eat, play, sleep, read a book, see a movie, go to the park, go to berkeley bowl, go to university of berkeley, etc. we can get on a highway that takes us to SF in 10 minutes, we can leave behind the car at the ashby bart if we want to be good to the environment, we have a place to park (secured on our lot) we have a washer and dryer (secured - no coins) we have internet access we have utilities FAQ availability - place just got posted, is available, but we got more responds then we expected, so pardon the generic reply: showing the unit - we will look at applications this week, show the unit the week of 01/11. earliest move-in will be 02/01, though 03/01 is preferable.kids - ok to have kids, there are schools, and a childrens hospital in the area supermarkets - plenty in the area... from shop n save, to safeway, to berkeley bowl, to whole foods layout - see picture below price - there's a 1BR 4 blocks away renting for 2500 - in fact, looking at 3900 Adeline, which is closer to best buy/ikea and highway noise, but further from UC Berkeley, Oakland down to Alameda, and you'll see STUDIOs renting for $1775 (not to mention parking) - look at the pricing in all of emeryville, and you find that it's already priced to rent. the market is hot, but we want a long term tenant so it's priced fairly.those who travel alot - you can leave your car and disappear whenever you'd like, just give us a notice so we don't worry about you check scams - no interest in cashing checks ahead of time and giving you the difference. delayed rental - looking to rent asap. not sure we could guarantee the place for anything more than a month delay, and only to the right candidate, with a deposit, and the other general warnings out of towners - no problem if you're relocating, and feel free to ask questions... again, if there's a delay in move, please make sure to communicate it early and see the above line move in costs - unless you're a terrible person, with terrible credit, and a terrible attitude, first+last month will be sufficient. DISHWASHER - YES, UPDATING THE POST TO REFLECT THAT TOO... THANKS FOR REMINDING US. anything else that was neglected in the posting - feel free to askThis unit is under 700 sqft. We had an earlier posting for a similar (slightly smaller) property down the street. That unit was rented out one day after posting and went for over asking, 6 months paid in advance. This location and price point are not going to be matched. We are looking for good long term tenants. Please allow 48 hours for responses.

description: This is an amazing large studio with hardwood floor on the 3rd floor. We have a park like backyard and parking. In short, I don't think you could find a better studio with everything that this has for $1700. The first open houses will be on Monday 22nd at 12pm & 6pm. Please meet outside. If I'm not there I'm probably showing the unit and will be back down in a few.â€¨â€¨540 Alcatraz avenue just down from Telegraph ave.â€¨â€¨This building was built in 1929. It has a large entryway with two closets. The living room is huge with large windows facing the hills. The living room has great 1920's wall mounted light fixtures and has a large walk in closet. The kitchen is big as well and has enough room for a good sized table near the windows in the dining area of the kitchen. There is no dishwasher or garbage disposal. The bathroom has a pedestal sink and tile floors.â€¨We have parking in our fenced in backyard for $65 or under the building for $80. Deposit is $500. No cat or dogs. We also have a giant back yard. It's like a small park back there and there is additional space where people have gardens. There is a laundry room in the basement with four washers and four dryers. The machines are coin operated. There's a bit of bike storage down there as well. â€¨The heat is steam and we pay for that as well as water and garbage. Nice savings there. The lease is one year which turns into month to month. You really have to check this out.â€¨You can also check out the you tube video of a studio. The video also shows the building and the grounds.www.youtube.com/watch?v=gQBENKWhG9Eâ€¨â€¨"We will have applications at the open house. If you have something put together already you can put it with our application in case yours doesn't have something that ours needs.We do need to run a credit check through National Tenant Network and that will cost $15 per adult. There is no other application fee. We would like to have a check for the fee since we do not carry change while showing apartments.We take applications and then choose based mainly on income and credit. Our application asks for the addresses and contact info for the last three apartments, employment info and contacts, other forms of income, large loan payment basic info such as car loans, your phone number and email, etc. This is just in case you want to save some time for yourself and have these things ready with copies that you can drop off at whatever open house you go to.

description: 3125 College Avenue, Unit #2Studio, 354 sq feet$1,895/mo, 12 Month Lease, $2,000 DepositAvailable for: April 1, 2016 or May 1, 2016 lease start dateUnit Status: VACANT -- Key Checkout @ Office (Details Below)Charming studio apartment located on College Avenue near the Elmwood and Rockridge neighborhood border!Located in the corner of the building, unit receives nice daytime sunlight and views of the front garden area. Unit has a full kitchen area that is separated off of the main living area. Feels more like a junior 1-bedroom than an actual studio unit!Beautifully maintained hardwood floors are located in the main living areas. Large, oversized walk-in closet offers lots of storage for this studio apartment. Bathroom was also remodeled in 2015 with new fixtures and amenities.Building is located a short walk to both the Elmwood and Rockridge shopping districts. Numerous shops and restaurants are just a short walk away. Downtown Berkeley and UC Berkeley can be accessed via bike or the 51B bus route on College Ave.3125 College #2 Floorplan (http://www.northberkeleyproperties.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/College-3125-2.pdf)Interior FeaturesÂ· Hardwood floorsÂ· Electric heatÂ· UnfurnishedKitchenÂ· Full kitchenÂ· Gas Stove / OvenÂ· RefrigeratorBathroomÂ· 1 Full BathroomBuilding FeaturesÂ· Street parkingÂ· 10 Units In BuildingÂ· Ground FloorÂ· Coin Operated LaundryOtherÂ· Garbage, Water IncludedÂ· Access to public transportationÂ· Gated Entry/IntercomÂ· Corner UnitÂ· No PetsÂ· No Smoking AllowedThis property is professionally managed by NORTH BERKELEY PROPERTIES.How to View our ListingsTo view "Vacant" units you will need to pick up a key from our office located at 2115 Shattuck Avenue in Downtown Berkeley. Our office hours are weekdays from 10am-1pm, 2pm-5pm -- the last key checkout time is @ 4pm and keys must be returned within a 2-hour checkout window or before the office closes.If you view a unit and are interested in applying please feel free to fill out an application for each person in your group. title: Elmwood Studio on College Ave - Close to Rockridge - Avail April/May

description: One bedroom available in a 2 bedroom/1 bath apartment in beautiful Elmwood (at College and Woolsey) starting April 1. This cheerful apartment gets lots of light and is set back from the street, so it's pretty quiet. It has a gas stove, hardwood floors, and washer and dryer. The bedroom can come furnished (full bed, dresser, nightstand, and lamp - see pictures) or not. It's about a 10 minute walk to Rockridge Bart and a 20 minute walk to the Berkeley campus (and the 51B runs along College). Safeway is a 5 minute walk away and Trader Joe's and Whole Foods are about 10, and it's a quick walk to all the charming Elmwood and Rockridge shops and restaurants. I'm a law student at Berkeley in my late-20s. I spend a lot of time studying, so I'm hoping to find someone that's pretty quiet and clean - but friendly too! Rent is $1350/mo (with a $1350 security deposit), and $35 application fee.If you're interested, send me an email with a little about yourself and we can set up a time to meet and for you to take a look at the place.

description: Gorgeous quiet central Berkeley one-bedroom apartment in nice neighborhood. Wall to wall rug in living room and bedroom, living room is 12' by 13', bedroom 10' by 10' not including a walk in closet. Living room has doors if you want to use it as a bedroom. Eat-in kitchen has many wood cabinets, 9'x13'. Kitchen windows face to lovely front garden with many flowers, the perfect place to enjoy morning sun. Large bathroom has tile floor, 8'x12'. There is a small hallway perfect for storage. The apartment is bright and sunny with a lot of windows.Lovely front garden with rosebushes, lemon tree and other pretty flowers.This is a great location--stroll to BART, 10 minutes by bike to UC, short block to shops, zip onto freeway. title: Bike to UC! Walk to Bart! Gorgeous Quiet Central Berkeley House

description: All utilities included two rooms with private entrance, private bathroom & private yard - $2100-25002 couples are allowed.Please also ccon the email. Both emails makes it easier.6 Bedrooms4 bathrooms (3 private & 1 shared)Can be rented individually (by room) or as a groupHouse has two seperate locakable entrances that can be separated to allow more privacyStackable laundry in houseComes furnished if desired - all new furnishings - Bed - 2 night stands - desk Great community. Both individual rooms and shares are available. We are looking for long term renters as well.Complete and tasteful full house renovation (2016 craftsman in a Great 100 year old neighborhood 3 minute walk to Ashby BART, Berkeley Bowl, 5 Cafe's, playhouse, library, tools library, Biodiesel station, 3 parks and more.This is a clean, non cluttered house. One of the biggest draws is our proximity to the closest BART station to San Francisco in Berkeley (1100 feet - 4 minute walk). There are only 3 stops before you get to the first stop in SF (Embarcadero). It takes 18 minutes to get to San Francisco. You literally DON'T need a car. You can walk or bike to Berkeley Bowl (Berkeley equivalent to Whole Foods but better prices and fruit / veggie selection), Walgreens, 5 cafes, 3 corner stores, art galleries and much more. You are literally in the "center" of Berkeley (from our perspective).The house was completely renovated from Oct 15-Jan 16 (last month):BEDROOMS: See below for detailed explanation. ALL PILLOWS AND DOWN COMFORTERS AND OF COURSE SHEETS ARE WASHED BEFORE A NEW PARTY ARRIVESPLUMBING: New on demand water heater and plumbing (great pressure) to allow all 4 bathrooms, the dishwasher and washing machine to run at once with unlimited hot water. You can literally take a 2 hour shower if you want4 SHOWERS: Granite and tile KITCHEN: Brand new kitchen with 8 foot slider to awesome deck leading to backyard. All new high end appliances, 5 burner stove, dishwasher, microwave, sink, fridge and large stackable washer dryerWHOLE HOUSE INSIDE AND OUTSIDE:: Painted 2 weeks ago, brand new double paned windows, digital entry locks (reset for each guest). Large stackable washer dryer in unit on main floor.BACKYARD: Bonfire. Huge back yard with brand new 9 foot redwood fence / bamboo surrounding property and organic vegetable garden you can eat from. Water fountain. Teak tables with heat lamps and umbrellas to seat 16 if needed. High chairs and boosters includedINGROUND HOT TUB: will be complete may 15NEIGHBORS: We live next door in a 3 story craftsman and are the most chill family you'll ever meet - if you decide you want to :) We are not nosy - you'll probably never see us. We don't care if you have parties (no keg stands), there is no curfew (the area has huge lots so no one cares if you make a little noise or have a bonfire. We are one of the neighbors and the other side are the most mellow people in the world.

HOA includes tennis courts, pool, mini golf and clubhouse.Living room w/handcrafted Tuscan fireplace, office/reading nook, bay windows plantation shutters, decks and panoramic Bay views from both the living and master bedrooms. Beautifully appointed eat-in kit w/custom cabinetry, granite counters, sub-zero fridge. Master suite w/vaulted ceiling, large outdoor deck. Lower level multipurpose room with laundry. Big enough for pool/ping pong table or rec room for kids. 2 car garage. Central vacuum system. Redwood patio deck with built in gas for BBQ.Quick access to Walnut Creek/San Francisco via Hwys 24 & 580, Claremont Country Club, and UC Berkeley. AC Transit line on Hiller Drive. No smoking. Prefer no pets, but pet fee if approved. 1 year lease preferred. $4500/mo + HOA fees. Verified references and income documentation.Contact Larry Lessler via this ad and to schedule a visit. tttlessleratgmailThank you

description: LUXURY ELMWOOD EDWARDIAN UPPER FLAT WITH GREAT LOCATION NEAR UC CAMPUS, COLLEGE AVE AND WHOLE FOODS* When you choose to live at Elmwood Estates you will find more than a place to live - you will find a home in a friendly triplex environment with luxury apartment features, exceptional amenities, security, safety and a fabulous locale. Classic Elmwood Edwardian architecture blended with modern Scandinavian design features, all done in a recent complete renovation from foundation to roof. Offered is a unique residential opportunity minutes from UC Berkeley, BART, College Avenue Shopping and Whole Foods. With propinquity such as this, no auto is needed. Consider this thoughtfully crafted space with custom features and attention to detail rarely found in apartment living. Complete recent remodel - no expense spared with attention to details. Berkeley meets Scandinavia. Architectural/ Kitchen layout / design by well-known local architect.* Maximum three tenants.* Redone white oak floors, dedicated gas hot water heater, direct vent gas heater, energy efficient windows and insulation for noise reduction and energy savings. Full bath, hand held shower. Linen closet. Grohe and Porche fixtures. Levelor opaque blinds, recessed lights w dimmers. Safety and security considered paramount. Controlled Access Building with front entry via intercom/buzzer, private rear entry access through security gate with keypad/remote. Sequential motion sensor lights create light pools to parking and rear patio area. Total seismic upgrade. High speed Wi-fi included, cable ready.* Rear outdoor screened space with garden, BBQ, patio area furnished with teak furniture, all protected by security gate. Controlled ambient lighting in BBQ/ garden space. Perfect for outdoor gatherings with friends and colleagues.* Kitchen with granite, built in eating area, stainless steel sink, pull out faucet, gas range and stove, range hood with direct vent, wine rack,wine glass holder, new cabinets, garbage disposal. Functional layout done in concert with local chef for gourmet cooking.* In unit high efficiency washer / dryer, unlimited use included in rent (goodbye coin operated machines!).*Secure bicycle parking, protected by security gate, camera, and motion sensor lights.*On site storage included.*Off street parking available in rear of building with security gate, remote/keypad access, camera and motion sensor light protection. Inquire for specifics.* Pets welcome - cats and dogs. Breed restrictions. Inquire for specifics. Canines in photo not included in lease.*Terms include security deposit 500.00 USD. Prefer long term tenant as community atmosphere is encouraged. Available May 1st, may view with 24 hours notice. Fabulous apt, last tenant for 3 years, will not be available long.* One bedroom and Studio also available.* Text communication preferredâ€¢	INCOME VERIFICATION o	Most recent pay stub, W-2, or tax return. Applicants that do not meet our income requirements must provide a guarantor application. International students should also provide proof of full time enrollment as well as proof of income in the form of most recent bank statement, or verifiable letter from your bank indicating your current balance in your account.o	Guarantor to sign and verify.

description: This one bedroom apartment is a cozy, quiet escape from the busyness of Berkeley. With high vaulted wood beam ceilings, a skylight, and a small wood-burning fireplace, this residence feels like a cabin. It has one spacious bedroom (including two large closets), one bathroom, a large living room, and a charming kitchen, making this apartment perfect for one resident. The apartment itself is tucked off the street, mitigating traffic noise. It has a small side yard, and is surrounded by large trees (redwoods) which keep the apartment cool through the summer. Its location is just off Ashby Ave, right near it's intersection with College Ave. It is close to public transportation, with the 51B stop at College and Ashby being on the same block. Also, as it is right off of College Ave, this apartment is no more than a five minute walk from a bakery, Elmwood Cafe, Ici's, La Med, and other great restaurants and small businesses.Per the landlord's request, this is a non-smoking apartment, with no pets allowed.I will be showing the place Friday (March 4th) from 11:30am - 2pm, or Sunday (March 6th) from 3pm-5pm. Please feel free to email me to let me know you are coming, and I will send you the address. When you get here, the apartment is tucked behind a large wood-shingled house. Just walk down the driveway (the driveway to the left of the house if you are facing it) and once you see the carport, turn right. The apartment door will be open. *note - due to high interest in the property, I am only able to respond via email. Please check your spam folder if you have not yet received a response*

description: 2821 Hillegass Avenue #122-Bedroom/1-BathAvailable June 15, 2016$2,795.00 /mo, 12 month lease$4,000.00 Security Deposit**OCCUPIED UNIT -- OPEN HOUSE Scheduled on SATURDAY March 12th @ 1-1:30PM**Charming 2-bedroom apartment available in the Hillegass Court Apartments for June 15th. Apartment has been updated with modern amenities but still retains its historical charms like hardwood floors and large built-ins. Kitchen was remodeled to feature stainless steel appliances (fridge/freezer, stove/oven, and microwave) and granite countertops. Bathroom has newer fixtures and has nicely done tiling and details.All the rooms in the apartment have nice daytime lighting and a view of the rear garden area. One bedroom is more cozy and better suited as a single. Second, larger bedroom has its own dedicated closet space and bay window.Building is conveniently located on Berkeley's bike boulevard network (Hillegass Avenue route) and is a short walk/bike ride to the UC Berkeley campus and Willard Park (1-block away). description: This apartment is a wonderful, large space in a 1906 house. It has a private side entrance with a tall spiral staircase leading to a deck with views of the east bay hills. It has a claw foot tub with shower and a private duel flush toilet and sink. The kitchen has counter height fridge and freezer and our counters are made of recycled bowling alley. There is a small Wedgewood stove with oven. The main floor of the house has some young (30+) professionals living downstairs. This artistic apartment comes furnished and would be perfect for quiet grad student. Close to West Berkeley restaurants and bus lines direct to UC Berkeley. Easy access to the freeway. Backyard for gardening. No pets. $1800 - includes utilities. Available now.

description: Plenty of room to stretch out in this rare Edwardian duplex. This duplex has a great floor plan. Upstairs has 3 bedrooms + Full Bath. Downstairs has 1 bedroom, 1/2 bath, Living room with working fireplace, and a bright and sunny kitchen with a deck overlooking garden.If you are looking for a a quiet neighborhood of families, students, working professionals, and artists in an ideal neighborhood that has a 10 minute walk to everything (UC Berkeley campus, Bart/Bus lines, and grocery stores), this is the perfect place.Some features: - Very large bedrooms (10x12, 13x15, 15x15, 15x15 w/6x8-bonus room). All rooms have ample closets.- Full bath upstairs with charming victorian claw-foot tub- Built-in cabinets, bay windows and old school charm victorian era clawfoot tubs, wood detailing, picture molding, and wainscoting, brick fireplace, and hardwood floors. - Large sunny kitchen for people who love to cook- Deck with French Doors overlooking landscaped gardenConvenient 10 -15 minutes walk to everything: - UC Berkeley Campus - Ashby or Berkeley Bart, AC Transit (F Transbay line) to San Francisco- Berkeley Bowl (Fresh produce & groceries), Whole Foods, Berkeley Downtown shops and restaurants.Other:- Great neighbors: students, working professionals and families in a quiet neighborhood- Onsite coin operated laundry- Plenty of street parkingIf interested in viewing, email us to set up an appointment. Do not disturb current tenants---------Other tidbits:- Rent is $4950 per month (includes water and garbage collection). Tenants responsible for all other utilities- Security Deposit is $5000- 1 year lease required. - Ideally looking for up to 4-5 responsible, non-smoking tenants to call this place home. We may consider a 6th. However, rent would be adjusted accordingly. 6 people Max. - Sorry, no pets- $35 non-refundable credit check fee once we get to final lease signing phase. - Available June 1

description: - Walk to school, BART, shopping and nightlife- Professionally managed- Open, spacious, and sunny- One standard bedroom and one large living room which has closing doors and a LARGE walk-in closet- Newly renovated kitchen with granite counters and tile floor- All new paint throughout- New ceiling fans in living room and bedroom- Pristine original hardwood floors- Tall ceilings- Water, garbage, hot water & room heat all paid, low electricity bills- Laundry facilities on site- Range & refrigerator includedOne year lease$2,685 security depositSorry, no petsNo sublettingThe next showings will be at:12:00pm sharp on Saturday, March 4thand 3:00pm sharp on Sunday, March 5thAt 2491 Ellsworth Street in Berkeley It's a locking building, so I will meet you out front and take you up at the showing time. Anyone who arrives after that will unfortunately miss the showingApplications are paper or pdf only, available at the end of the viewing.All applicants over 18 need to fill out an application and provide a $40 application fee in cashier's check or money order payable to Picardo Arms Apartments.There is a $100 holding deposit. We only process one person's or one set of roommates' applications at a time. The deposit takes the apartment off the market and is refundable for up to three business days. After that, it's non-refundable. Bring all of your documents at the same time, and we process your application well within the three days. If you pass, the deposit becomes the first $100 of your security deposit. If you don't pass, even if your application is processed after the three business days, we return the $100 to you. The $40 application fees are non-refundable once the applications are processed regardless of the result.Applicants must show combined income of at least 3x the rent amount per month gross (pre-tax) and good credit based in the U.S. If credit and income aren't met (and the applicant does not have overly poor credit) then a cosigner may be used. A cosigner applies in the same way with another $40 application fee. A copy of a passport or driver's license and proof of income is required for each application. Proof of income can be in the form of two recent pay stubs, social security checks, pension, trust fund or support checks, or tax returns.Note for new international residents: if you don't have a credit history in the U.S. because of your national status, you may be exempt from the credit requirement; however, you will still need to meet the income requirement and will be required to pay an increased security desposit.All fees and charges, including move in fees, must be in the form of cashier's check or money order, payable to Picardo Arms. Once you are a tenant, from your 2nd month onward, you may pay by personal check.

description: Video tour:https://youtu.be/zOY_cLGNBxgAVAILABLE: April 1 Thru October 31 (could be later) - I'm taking off for a 6 month hike and could live in my camper for a couple months when I get back if you needed to go through December.FINANCIAL STUFF:Monthly: 2,495Deposit: 2,495Pets: Will accept a small dog, if you watch my small dog (or I'll have my parents watch my dog)Utilities: All includedSELLING POINTS:*Furnished*Newly Renovated, hard wood built in cabinetry in kitchen, living room, and bedroom, and new flooring and painted house and rooms.*Hot tub access*Victorian features*High ceilings*Bay windows*Large windows (natural light)*You can see mt. tam from the dining room.*Walk 2 BART*Near major bus lines (51,72, SF commuter)*Near strawberry creek park (w/cafÃ©, yoga studio, etc).*Washing maching (dishes)*Coin Op washer/dryer in yard (cloths)*Access to a small shared yard that has a hot-tub.NEIGHBORHOOD:Walking to BART, transit, park.Places to eat (over 10 resturaunts) including Your place Thai and Land Splitters.Near pubs (acme, albatross. . . and not too far from Missouri lounge)Places to buy food (several small grocery stores)Post office, cheese store, german food, chineese food, Pakistani food, Indian, thai, Italian, cafÃ©. . .. . ... moreNeighbors are a mix of new money and working class families.There is a youth center that get graffiti on the building at times.There are million dollar homes.There are shitty looking apartment buildings.There are tennis courts, basketball court, volleyball net.Bank, hardware store.Basically, the only thing I think you can not buy in the neighborhood is sheets and pillows (use amazon). . . Neighborhood has what you need.DESCRIPTION OF THE UNITAs you enter it, you enter into a large Living Room with a gas fireplace with built in hardwood shelving, couches, and a hang out area. To the right is a large bedroom with a bay window and tall ceilings and a closet as well as a built in wood closet. Off the living room is an entrance to the kitchen (which is not huge in size, but has built in cabinetry that is douglas fir, granite countertops, and newly renovated. The kitchen has a dishwasher, cabinets, stove, fridge, microwave etc. . . Off of the kitchen is the Bathroom. This place is in a tri-plex where a neighbor shares the bottom floor and the top floor is another neighbor. Just outside through the backdoor off of the kitchen is a small side-yard that has a Hot-Tub as well as a laundry area and places to put things under the house or stash your bike.Video tourhttps://youtu.be/zOY_cLGNBxgCan be furnished or unfurnished.Email me for more info or if you have any questions or would like to arrange a time to see it.
title: April Thru October - Video Tour - Built in wood cabinetry
