description: Avail Now! Studio Apartment 1/2 Block To UCB!As Close As You Can Get To UCB! Closer than the Dorms!Address: 2312 Ellsworth St., Unit #10City: BerkeleyArea: Berkeley - South CampusAvailable: 3/1/16 or Now!Rent: $1,295.00Size: StudioOpen House: Sun 02/21 @ 2:45 PMContact InformationLillian WhiteLeasing AgentDRE Lic. #01467778More Info & Pics For This Rental: http://www.premiumpd.com/details_n1.php?unit_id=565&index=0&type=rentOther Properties For Rent: http://www.premiumpd.com/listings.php?type=rentOpen House Schedule: http://www.premiumpd.com/hotlist.php?openhouse=1Sign Up For Daily Listing Updates: http://www.premiumpd.com/login.phpProperty & Unit DescriptionEllsworth Apartments2312 Ellsworth StreetBerkeley CA 94704 The Ellsworth Building has approximately 20 apartments and is located just Â_ blocks from the UC Berkley Campus. The building consists of 2 separate complexes both of which have studios, 1 & 2 bedroom apartments. Although the apartment buildings are super close to the UC Berkeley campus, cafes, bookstores, parking garages and the Edward Dome Stadium, the apartment building is quiet and peaceful nestled far away from the street towards the back of the property. Tenants experience a great deal of privacy living in "The Ellsworth Building" although they are minutes to the University.Currently we have a lovely studio apartment as close to UC Berkley as you can get. If you want convenience and the ability to walk to class within 5 minutes, this is the apartment for you!Neighborhood InformationNeighborhoodThe Ellsworth building is located just Â_ block to the UC Berkeley Campus and 2 blocks to downtown Berkeley, BART and Telegraph Avenue which is famous for its wide selection of eclectic retail stores, street vendors, parking garages and book stores. In the opposite direction is Shattuck Avenue, bursting with a huge variety of restaurants, juice bars, and ice cream shops. Around the corner is CafÃ© Espresso Experience, a great place for a cup of coffee and a delicious pastry. Everything is within reach from The Ellsworth Apartments.Ellsworth is perfect for those who want to live where the action is. Directly across the street many students, visitors and the San Francisco Bay Area community are entertained by Cal Performances located in the well know "Zellarbach Auditorium". Cal Performances is a vital cultural resource of the Berkley Community and everyone is invited to discover and engage with the many performances, educationally seminars, and free events throughout the year. You will also enjoy UC Berkeley's RSF which houses an Olympic-sized swimming pool, indoor basketball courts, weight rooms, squash courts, and sports fields such as CAL Tennis, Track and field.Property FeaturesTHIS STUDIO FEATURES:Basement Unit W/ Exterior Entry(Not much light if that's what you need)Carpet ThroughoutKitchenette OnlyOnly 1/2 Block from UC &Telegraph Ave.Super Close To RSFWASHER/DRYR IN THE BUILDING!Water and Garbage are IncludedProfessionally Property Managed More Info & Pics For This Rental: http://www.premiumpd.com/details_n1.php?unit_id=565&index=0&type=rentOther Properties For Rent: http://www.premiumpd.com/listings.php?type=rentOpen House Schedule: http://www.premiumpd.com/hotlist.php?openhouse=1Sign Up For Daily Listing Updates: http://www.premiumpd.com/login.php

description: We are looking for a roommate for the living room in a two-bedroom apt in downtown Berkeley. The move-in date is immediate.The lease ends by late July or early August, 2016. Long-term is possible after move-in.You will be living with two girls. I'm an undergrad majored in Psychology. My roommate works at SF, and she's only home during nights/weekend. We prefer UC Berkeley affiliated students, scholars and faculty. We also prefer same gender roommate.The location is on 2020 Kittredge St, Berkeley. The property is professionally managed by Library Gardens. The place is right next to Downtown Berkeley Bart Station, and Target, Walgreens, Starbucks, Bank of America and many many restaurants. The living-room is now for rent: $870/month with about $30 utility (wifi included)The apartment building is really new and has all the facilities you need. We also keep the apartment very clean and nice. - Living room has windows with great light source- Free WIFI- Well furnished, secured gate, laundry on the same floor- The kitchen has everything, oven, microwave, dishwasher and fridge.- You can get a room divider to ensure privacy- Quiet living environment- Parking garage available at $115/monthEmail me if you're interested with questions, a little bit background information and move-in date.Thanks!

description: Ready for lease is a large studio apartment at $1,550 per month. It is a one room apartment, has beautiful hardwood floors and two panoramic windows (in the main room and kitchen) that let in great amounts of natural light. The kitchen is generously sized with granite counter tops and an electric stove.The location of the building is the best you can get. It is next to a bike path, the 51B, Transbay, and FS buses stop right outside the front door, is only 4 blocks away from the North Berkeley BART station, and located halfway between the Eastshore Freeway and UC Berkeley on University Avenue. Parking is available in the garage for $80/month.We have a no pet policy (unless required by a disability) and no smoking is allowed.Steam heat, trash collection, recycling, water and hot water are included. Coin-operated laundry machines are located downstairs.The lease is one-year, with first month's rent and a security deposit of $2,500 due at signing. If you feel like this building would be a great fit for you, feel free to send me an email with a short bio to set up a viewing.

Looking to move this Fall? We have the perfect apartment!

description: This could be your new home! California Apartments is a restored 90-year-old building with many long-term residents. The apartments in this vintage building have hardwood floors, tall ceilings, gas stoves and great bathtubs. There is on-site laundry and a community garden. We value our home and we are looking for someone who is friendly and quiet and wants to be a part of our community. This unit is available now. Are you our next neighbor?OPEN HOUSESunday, Feb 28, 10-11amCall or text me (Dorrit, the on-site manager) if you have any questions.APARTMENT DESCRIPTION *1920s stucco building * Hardwood floors * Large, walk-in closets (you won't believe the closet space!)* Eat-in kitchen with gas stove* Gas oven and gas heat* 9 foot ceilings * Full bathroom with bathtub/shower * Double-paned windows* Owner pays water, hot water, garbage * Tenant pays gas, electric & phone * One-year lease minimumLOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION* Four blocks to the North Berkeley BART Station * Six blocks to downtown Berkeley and the Berkeley BART* Five blocks to Trader Joe's* Two blocks to Ohlone Park and close to the Ohlone Bike Path* Walking distance to the Berkeley Rep, Freight & Salvage, movie theaters and restaurants* On a major bus line (the 51* Easy access to 4th Street, the freeway, Gourmet Ghetto, and much, much more!BUILDING AMENITIES * Friendly, on-site management * Controlled-access entry and intercom system * Coin-operated laundry room on premises * Parking space available in secured lot for an extra $95 per month * Secure bicycle parking (free!) * Community Garden! APPLICATION PROCESS * completed and signed application form * proof of income equaling 2 times the monthly rent (check stubs) * copy of recent bank statement * non-refundable fee of $20 for a credit check MOVE-IN COSTS* First month's rent * $2000 deposit OTHER INFO* No pets * No smoking* No handicapped access (Sorry, old building! There is an elevator once you are inside, but there are a few steps at the entrance of the building.) * Photos are of similar apartment
title: charming 1920s studio near BART & Downtown

description: 2057 University Avenue was formerly known as the University Hotel. The University Hotel is no longer in operation and the building has since been converted into an apartment building which offers single room apartments. The building is located on University and Shattuck Avenue. It is located 2 blocks away from the west end of the UC Berkeley Campus. It is a few short blocks away from modes of public transportation such as AC Transit and Bart. The Downtown Berkeley Bart Station connects Berkeley with the greater Bay Area. Bart, which is the Bay Area's Rapid Transit rail system makes it possible to reach destinations such as Downtown San Francisco or the San Francisco International Airport in a matter of minutes. The building is nearby the many eateries, shops, and businesses which make up Downtown Berkeley located on Shattuck Avenue. You will be sharing a common bathroom with all utilities included. Please call Raj Properties atThe room is a single dorm style room with a private bathroom. The room is ideal for a person looking to live a minimalist lifestyle. The room itself is cozy and includes built in wall shelves and a desk and chair. The room also includes a mini refrigerator and a microwave. The room does not have a kitchen sink or stove. The building has a lot of character. Walking through the hallways transports you to another time in Berkeley's history.We have Several One Bedrooms Available Now or Soon Renting for $1195 We have a One Bedroom/ 1 Bathroom Available Now Renting for $1295If you are interested in viewing the room in person please call our leasing office between the hours of 8:00am and 5:00pm Monday through Friday. We look forward to speaking with you.

description: Please see photos above and on Flickr (follow the links below). This lovely cottage has a flexible floor plan and can be set up with two separate bedrooms, each with their own entrance, living areas, closets and and equal access to the private kitchen and bathroom and living room/dining room. Alternatively, it can be used as a 1 bedroom with separate living and dining rooms.Available June 1, a beautiful large two bedroom cottage in charming Normandy Village, a Berkeley Landmark one half block north of the University of California on quiet, residential Spruce St..Resembling the quaint villages of provincial France, Normandy Village is delightful and a short walk to the UC campus, downtown Berkeley, public transportation, BART and the "Gourmet Ghetto" restaurants and shops. Great tranquil setting on a large, sunny, park like property with open space, trees and gardens.The product of inspired architecture and craftsmanship. You will find many quality features inside and outside the building including high cathedral ceiling, lovely hardwood floors, antique brick fireplace, heavy solid wood doors, redwood paneling and trim with hand carved details and ironwork.This flat will be furnished to suit your needs.Available starting June 1, a large two bedroom flat for $3000 per month with year lease. Please call for details.Also coming available: Normandy Village  and . title: Best Location ** 1865 EUCLID AVE**

address: Martin Luther King Jr Way at Francisco
description: The basics:*Room available for $860 in 5-bedroom, 2-bathroom unit*Northwest of campus at MLK Jr. Way & Francisco St.*Available April 1st*Gender balance: 2 girls, 3 guysThe location:We're in a 5-bedroom, 2-bathroom unit in a big Victorian-looking house (the house is divided into four separate units) in downtown/north Berkeley. It's a great location: three blocks/5-minute walk from University Ave. (including bus lines and Trader Joe's); a 10-minute walk to downtown Berkeley BART and west campus (along Oxford St.); and a 10-minute walk to the Gourmet Ghetto (Cheeseboard, Andronico's, Safeway, etc.).The street is residential and the neighborhood is very nice to walk around. Besides being close to North Shattuck and University Ave., we're also a couple blocks from the Ohlone Greenway (at Hearst and MLK) and about half a mile to the track at Martin Luther King Middle School (at Hopkins and MLK).The place:We have the entire top (third) floor of the house, which includes five good size bedrooms, two big bathrooms, and a kitchen/common area with hardwood floor, a dishwasher, and lots of natural light. The available bedroom is $860/month and has a window, a skylight, a mirrored closet and carpet floors. It's about 11 x 17 ft.We share utilities, which average to about $60/month (we have Comcast internet and TV, and also pay for PG&E and water). There is a coin-operated washer and dryer for laundry downstairs (shared by the four units); it's $1.25 to wash, $1.25 to dry. The house also has access to a bike rack and outdoor patio with some seating and a barbecue. Our landlord is responsive and takes great care of the place, including landscaping and addressing maintenance issues if they arise. We're all pretty clean, and it's been easy to keep the bathrooms and common areas nice -- we share the costs of trash bags, toilet paper, etc. (which usually isn't much; when someone buys something for the house, they mark it on our spreadsheet so it is incorporated into the rent).One last note: Sorry, but we can only have one person in the room, and aren't able to have cats or dogs in the house. Also, smoking is not allowed in the house.The parking situation:If you have a car, there's free parking on one side of MLK (excluding one street sweeping day per month), though it's a good idea to get a parking permit with the city for $55/year to be able to park anywhere in this part of town (you'd just need to re-register your car to this address).You'd be joining four awesome housemates: Louis is a 4th year PhD student at Cal. A native Midwesterner and adopted East Coaster before heading west, he is still amazed by the number of hikes within 2 hours of Berkeley. Officially, he's training to be an environmental and energy economist. Unofficially, he's an avid foodie, an amateur pianist, an up-and-coming runner, and a recovering night owl.Daniel is a 5th year PhD Student at Cal, who moved to Berkeley from Australia, although most folks think he sounds British (including some Australians). He loves reading, exercising, singing and coffee. He is indifferent to vegemite.Andrea is an Architectural Designer, working towards becoming a full-blown Architect. She is originally from Sacramento and loves sports of any kind, preferring to play them rather than watch them. She also loves to cook, hike, bike, ski, kayak, creative projects, laugh and likes to keep things clean and organized.Harrison is a jovial fellow who is fiercely proud of both his Bostonian and Greek heritages. He drives his car for Lyft whilst planning new travel adventures, and career moves. He also enjoys food, discussing politics, religion, and pretty much anything you want to talk about. He's an inquisitive soul.We're all pretty low-key and maintain an easy-going environment in our house; people do their own thing, but we're all friendly and chat when we're cooking/hanging out/watching TV in the kitchen/common area. People are also always welcome to have friends over for dinner, to hang out, etc. Please feel free to contact us with any questions, or to set up a time to stop by the house.

It's also great to have the leasing office to handle your package for you when you are not home. The lease can start in March, and ends on July 31st, 2016. description: These large, beautiful colonial style duplexes are located 1/2 a block from UC campus on quiet, desirable north side. Surrounded by 1/2 acre landscaped grounds and close to the gourmet ghetto, transportations, shops as well as other conveniences. There are three units available starting Jun 3. All units have hardwood floors, a fire place in the living room, tiled kitchen and baths as well as some furnishings (sofa, coffee table, dinning table and chairs etc.). There are washer and dryer in each unit. Owner pays for garbage. Parking if available is with a fee. Sorry, no smoking or pet please. 1747 Spruce, $5800: A top floor 1500 sq.ft. unit that can be used as 3 bedrooms, one bath. It has lovely bay view and a balcony, unit can accommodate 6-7 persons. 1743 Spruce, $6500:Two story 1500 sq.ft., it can be used as 3 bedroom, 1.5 baths and has a kitchen that opens to a private back yard. One of the bedrooms is about 300 sq.ft. Unit can accommodate 7-8. 1755 Spruce, $7200:Two story 1700 sq.ft., it can be used as 4 bedrooms,, 1.5 baths. One of the bedrooms is about 300 sq.ft. description: One room available for rent in a beautiful North Berkeley home. We are having a roommate move out next week and the bedroom pictured with an attached private bathroom will be available for approximately 1-2 months only, depending on your circumstances. We are all in our mid-twenties with full time jobs, enjoying evenings on the couch, one of the roomies is in a band...The house has a total of 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a huge kitchen, washer&dryer, and deck with amazing views. Currently living in the home are 4 young professionals who are very clean and friendly. Both the Cal campus and Bart are one mile away for a simple commute. Easy street parking in the neighborhood and room to store your bike in the garage. House has heating/air, cable, wifi. The bedroom available (approx. 12x15') has two huge walk-in closets and windows that face the front yard. The bedroom is hardwood and the bathroom is tile with a shower and plenty of light. Both will be completely empty and clean upon move-in. $1500/mo with all utilities included, $1900 for couples. Unfortunately no pets!
title: One Room in Beautiful Berkeley House

description: I am looking for one mature and reliable person to live in my adorable studio. There is a private bathroom, pull out love seat, a natural gas fire pit in the yard, a storage shed, a gas grill, and a few fruit trees. There is a kitchenette with a nice double induction burner, blender/food processor, induction kettle, microwave, convection oven, plenty of storage space,and mini-fridge. The room is fully furnished with queen bed, pillows, desk and chair, heater, sheets, towels, and kitchen supplies (including some staples like spices, rice, four, oil, etc). I will even consider letting you use my bike if you are trustworthy. The place is really cute with lots of light. The neighborhood is very quiet. There is a great park 2 blocks away and many groceries, coffee shops, laundromats, bars, and restaurants within walking distance. There is a bus at the end of the street that gets you right onto campus within 15 minutes or you can bike there in 15 minutes. You have a pretty great view of the city from the top of the driveway as this neighborhood is up on a hill. Landlord is fine with guests as long as you let her know.The move in/out dates are semi-negotiable but you would have to be out by August 21st at the latest. $500 deposit (refundable assuming no damage). Rent includes all utilities. No pets - sorry. There are a few odd things about the place. The cottage is a mother-in-law suite - as in: it is in the backyard of the main house where the landlord and her 2 children live. The bathroom that goes with the cottage is connected to the back of the main house. It is a private bathroom with only one entrance from the outside which is about ten steps outside the front door of the cottage. So you have to walk outside to get to the bathroom, but not far, and it is your bathroom alone. Also - there is no sink in the studio so you have to do dishes in the bathroom sink. I have a dish drainer setup in the bathroom and the sink is not prohibitively small. While this is a strange setup, I have never had issues with it at all.The landlord will want to meet you but other than that you won't interact with her much. You basically have 100% privacy in the unit and backyard and it is nice and quiet.
title: Adorable mother-in-law suite in Berkeley/Albany

description: $2450, Large 2 bedroom 1 bath Quiet Lafayette, Top Floor View, Deck, close to BART SF, UC Berkeley, Reservoir& downtown Just finishing a comprehensive remodel and updating of our large 2 bedroom 1 bath home plus a garage located in downtown Lafayette Village Area three plex. Our home is approximately 1000 square ft.This location is ideal for those who enjoy easy safe walking or bike riding distance to downtown but far enough away from the traffic with easy access to the freeways (Hwy. 24, 2 minutes) and BART (.7 mi) 20 minute to Downtown San Francisco by BART. U.C. Berkeley Campus, Lawrence Hall of Science, HAAS school of Business , Boalt Law School , Lawrence Berkeley National Lab are within very short driving distance. Easy walking distance to the Lafayette Reservoir (http://www.ebmud.com/recreation/east-bay/lafayette-reservoir/ ).Newly painted kitchen including gas range, refrigerator, windows with brushed nickel Hansgrohe faucet and sprayer. Views from the kitchen and breakfast area overlooking the Lafayette hills and Village area.The city of Lafayette is a beautiful, desirable sought after neighborhood with hip coffee houses, amazing bakeries, great restaurants, with cool shopping spots, including Diablo Foods, Trader Joes, Whole Foods, etc. Bathroom remodeled and includes, whisper fan, lighting and double mirrored door medicine cabinet (30" BY 26 "Kohler) including inside mirrors. A newer efficient energy saving forced heater system for efficient heating. Included also is a air-conditioner and ceiling fans.Off the kitchen is the in-house washer and dryer laundry and storage areas.Large garage and storage space also included.The living room looks out 6 large 6' windows to the private deck around old oak trees to see for Lafayette Valley and surrounding hill tops. Bedrooms are 12 by 12 and 12 by 9 feet.Our home has been fully painted, well cared for and ready to enjoy.Please email us if you might have interest with some background on yourselves.We apologize for the picture quality and hope to update this soon.Regards,IsabelleAbout Lafayette from Sunset Magazine September 2015 front inside bay area column."This mellow East Bay enclave has fashioned itself into a charming hub of its own, thanks largely to residents taking it upon themselves to open independent shops and restaurants they tired of longing for," the article states. "Now it's a melting pot of locals and day-trippers seeking good food without the lines, and handcrafted goods minus the hype."
title: Large 2 bedroom 1 bath Quiet Lafayette Top Floor View Deck

description: Beautiful Modernist home, 5 min from UC Berkeley campus. Formerly owned by the famous architect and former chairman of Landscape Architecture for UC Berkley and UCLA, Garrett Eckbo. Nestled in the scenic Berkeley Hills 1 mile north of Berkeley Campus neighborhood walks are complete with Berkeley Rose Garden, meandering walking trails through the hills, Tilden Park, and vistas at every turn. Close to Alice Waters' Chez Panisse restaurant, Cheese Board, Organic Markets, fabulous cafes.The studio apartment is private with gorgeous views of garden from two walls of the unit. Queen size bed with memory foam mattress, limestone bath and kitchenette. High speed internet, cable, in floor radiant heat, weekly cleaning and laundry included. Bus stops 1/8 mi from house and will take you mile to north gate of campus or 1 mile from downtown area ( passing Gourmet Gulch). 1 mile from Tilden Park. Fully furnished and ready to move in. Great place to work, write, rest. Short term 3 - to 10 months. Additional furniture not allowed.- All utilities included- High speed internet and cable tv included- Weekly cleaning and 1 bag of laundry included- In floor radiant heat throughout- Disposal- Instant hot water,- Microwave and toaster oven- cooktop- kitchen utensils and all cookware included- Limestone bathroom with large sand blasted glass window in shower enclosure- private garden area and entrance- low voltage lighting- high speed internet- Cable TVAvailable June 1 to single, non-smoking person.

description: Beautifully remodeled 4-5 BR Home in North Berkeley is almost complete, and available now for unfurnished rental at a discounted rent as we put the finishing touches on the project. Location is just up the hill, roughly a 5-6 block walk from the pleasures of Solano Avenue's neighborhood commercial district. The approx. 100-year-old home has been tastefully remodeled to architect specifications, honoring its original architectural style.This Brown Shingle home of approx 2500 s.f. features: Drop-dead 3-bridge and Bay views from generous-sized Master Suite with separate tub + shower and twin sinks. Three other BR's on this level with a shared 2nd bathroom and laundry room. Sunny large Basement level family room has its own entrance and private bath and additional laundry and could be used as a 5th BR. Middle floor has light-filled large Living room with woodburning fireplace and bookshelves, gracious entry Hall, Powder Room and Formal Dining room all with lovely wood accents. Spacious remodeled Kitchen with stainless higher end appliances, has walk-out deck access facing large back yard, with lemon tree and plenty of undomesticated lawn to run around in. Parking is available in the driveway for 2 cars, plus more street parking a half block away. One cat permitted, additional cats at additional charge.Financial Details:Full rent amount: $6200 per month. Tenant to pay for PGE, Cable/phone, Garbage, Water.Discounted rent amount, beginning immediately will be $1000 per month discount from the full amount, refunded each month within 10 days following payment of full rent amount. Written month-to-month rental agreement required. Good credit/income required. Payment of move-in costs by cashiers or bank check only.Payment of monthly rent via EFT or other money transfer only. Move-in costs: Balance of first month (if you don't move in on the first) plus 2 months additional to be held as security/damage/last month's. Project Upgrade Details:The following upgrades will be completed during the first few months of the rental, and account for the discounted rent amount during that period:Detached garage will be partially emptied and concrete floor replacement will continue after City approvals obtained. Minor landscaping will be performed and fencing repairs.Possible window upgrades may be performed (many windows already replaced)General maintenance and touch-ups to iron out any kinks in all the newly re-done systems. As part of your rent discount, you agree to cooperate with reasonable scheduling requests around these projects. Available now or March depending on your need. We'll be having an open house on Sunday Feb 28, from 10:30-11AM. Please email for address or to ask questions. Include a phone number if you wish and I look forward to talking, texting or emailing soon.
title: Remodeled Brown Shingle North Berkeley $5200-6200 4-5 BR 3.5 BA

It has an open floor layout for the dining area and living room. Master suite with full bathroom, 2nd bedroom & full bathroom in hallway. 1,150 square foot of living space. Community features: elevator, secured entry, controlled access, swimming pool, fitness center, tennis courts, gated garage parking, and courtyard with great San Francisco & Golden Gate view.Short walking distance to Pacific East Mall with Ranch 99 supermarket, restaurants, & many other stores. AC Transit Bus stops step away from the front of the complex. Carpool pick up spot to SF is in front of the plaza. Albanystill has no parking meters!!! (This is how Berkeley once was...)Info: 2 bed 2 bath apartment, 1,150 sf of living space and patio with park mountain view - one assigned parking - washer/dryer in building - tenant pays electricity - owner covers water, cable TV and garbage. Please email to schedule a showing.Thank you for your interest.

description: Renters are facing really difficult times right now with very high rent, crazy security deposits, no pets being accepted and landlords want you to have perfect credit and income 3 times or 4 higher than the rent just to allow you to rent their house and pay it off for them. Then they want to increase the rent every time the lease it up and in many cases ask you to move so they can sell the house or move back into it. We can send you all of the program information in writing just by sending a request. it includes all of our licensing information. You can call Lynne Duban the Finance Director atto qualify as long as you have a 580 or higher credit score and can document your income. We get so many people who worry this is a scam but everything we provide you is verifiable through multiple governmental sources.I have sold homes from Berkeley to Discovery Bay for 27 years. I have managed special financing programs provided by the State and Federal Government that encourage renters to become home owners by providing financing options that don't require perfect credit and in most cases cost less to get into than a rental these days. The financing is 30 year fixed rate and includes property taxes, and all the insurance. Simply put, people who bought homes 15 years ago are still paying the same payment they had originally and you will have the same payment 15 years after you buy the house. Landlords will obviously not be keeping the rent at the same level.In addition there are tax benefits that you get as a homeowner that help most people save thousands per year in Income Tax. This is the part where many people start to think this is a scam or baloney in general. To help with that we offer two things. I am going to give you ways to confirm the information. In addition I can send you an e mail that has both detailed breakdowns on the programs as well as an e mail that has the properties available with pictures and details. The programs that we utilize are FHA, VA, USDA Guaranteed, we also use CHDAP California Housing Down Payment Assistance Program, and CHFA California Housing Finance Agency. These last two programs are state based and provide almost 100% of the down payment you need for the FHA Loan. USDA and VA don't require any down payment. This house in Discovery Bay is just 1 of 57 available in Brentwood and Discovery Bay. It offers 3 Bedrooms, 2 1/2 Bathrooms and over 2000 square feet and is in beautiful condition. Its on a 9000 square foot lot with a 2 car attached garage and side access right near the lake.The other 56 houses range in size from 1,000-3900 square feet and 2-5 bedrooms. The monthly payments range from $1950-$3400. The cost to move into one of the homes will typically be $3,000-$5,000. Your first payment will not be due until 30 days after you move in. To qualify you will need the following minimum qualificationsA credit score that is 580 or higher (You can check your score at credit karma if you aren't sure)Proof of income in the form of 30 days paystubs and the last 2 tax returnsNo Short Sale Bankruptcy or Foreclosure in the last 3 yearsEric Wexelman Licensed by the California Department of Real Estate. Texts and E mails are responded to fastest as I can't answer the phone when I am with other clients. I WILL SEND YOU A FULL BREAKDOWN ON THE PROGRAMS AND HOW TO QUALIFY AND ALL THE PROPERTIES INCLUDING PICTURES AND DETAILS IF YOU TELL ME WHICH CITIES YOU ARE INTERESTED IN.
title: ITS TIME TO STOP RENTING AND OWN GOVERNMENT PROGRAMS IN DISCOVERY BAY

description: Your new lovely 2 story flat in this accessory unit is located midway up on the El Cerrito Hills with gorgeous views of the Golden Gate Bridge, S.F., Mt. Tam, Bay Bridge, and all the waters in between. This is where you sip wine, meditate, watch the sunsets and write your blogs. Your home has 2 major decks on two levels with 3 BR (one ensuite) and 2 BA, floor to ceiling windows and patio door entrance stepping onto two very spacious decks overlooking the views and the garden. The bedrooms measure: 12' x 12', 13.5' x 10.5' and 13.5' by 8.75' in addition to the normal sized wall closets. The open concept kitchen is connected to the living room space for a measurement of approx. 19' L x 11' W. The newly renovated flats have hardwood floors throughout, LED lighting, energy efficient refrigerator, dishwasher, dual pane windows, granite kitchen counter & fresh paint. The western bridge & water view and sun exposure. The open and spacious yard is full of trees bearing organic grapefruits and pear fruits from early spring through fall. Laundry on-site. Convenient street parking. Multiple decks & stairs lead to the two entry doors, so not wheelchair accessible.Open house Saturday & Sunday (2/27 - 2/28/16: 9:30-11:30 A.M.Looking for: - Responsible & Quiet tenant with good rental history - Someone who is easy to work with- Good Credit required- Non-smoker- Sorry, no petsAvailable March 1st. $3450 monthly rent, $3,300 security deposit. Tenant responsible for prorated gas/electric, water and garbage. One year lease or longer. Available to show most days with a couple of hours notice. Please call Evato schedule. Call Amy(sorry, no text) upon arrival for viewing.About the neighborhood: Leafy streets dotted with neighborhood parks wind their way up the hill, leading to beautiful estates with impeccably manicured gardens and panoramic views of San Francisco Bay and Marin. The property is located in a very accessible neighborhood! Three (3 min drive/8 min bike/15 min walk to El Cerrito Plaza BART (10 minutes to downtown Berkeley, 25 to San Francisco) and the Fairmount Mall, packed with all the box stores and a great Italian restaurant and 5 blocks from a cultural selection of restaurants, cafes, and Natural Grocer on San Pablo Ave., a 5 min drive to the very quaint Kensington Circle where you'd find charming pub with British fare, beer & live music, along with other shops in the European like village setting. 5 Minutes to Freeway access About El Cerrito: El Cerrito hosts a local farmer's market twice a week at the El Cerrito Plaza, which is also home to major chains including Bed Bath & Beyond and Barnes & Noble. Remnants of "old El Cerrito" can still be found on San Pablo Avenue where merchants include a funky store specializing in acoustic and folk music and Giovanni's Italian Grocery.El Cerrito is strategically located along Interstate 80 and is less than 30 miles from San Francisco and Oakland International airports. Its extensive transportation system includes two BART stations, direct bus lines to Berkeley, downtown San Francisco and Oakland, and 5 minutes to freeway access.

description: Available from Sep 7 for non-smokers only;Fully Furnished with complete accommodation Queen size bed, linens, towels, kitchenware, and all the small stuff one may need! Wi Fi included.; A cozy good size studio 2 blocks from Downtown Point Richmond on a quite street.If you want a modern place may be this one is not for you . . . but, if you yearn for a Victorian sunny habitat with view from above and high ceiling . . .located 2 blocks from downtown Point Richmond. Quiet, upscale residential neighborhood. A short walk to restaurants, bars, shopping, public library, post office, banks etc. It also has one of the best closed heated swimming pools in the country, many parks, trails, historic sight and one of the best views of the bay, swimming beach all in walking distance.A bright, sunny end unit with a private deck. . Features a kitchen with cupboard/closets space, gas stove & full size refrigerator. Washer Dryer on-site.Gas cooking, cold and hot water, and garbage are included (tenant pays for electricity only). A large "community" back yard/deck with a little garden which gets afternoon sun; a good place for sun-bathing and barbecuing. On-site laundry facility and ample street parking are available.Located in a quite upscale residential neighborhood just one short block from charming Point Richmond downtown with some 30 restaurants, couple of coffee shops (yes, Starbucks too) couple of fancy, but law cost restaurant bars just like in the City of San Francisco (other than the cost . . .)Point Richmond is as safe as it gets: For the past 30 years there has been no shooting out in the streets EVER in point Richmond.HIDDEN GEM: The people of Point Richmond are very serious about keeping it upscale, quiet and friendly. It has everything that Sausalito and Tiburon across the bay have, just better: The heel is more beautiful, ask the painters who come to Point Richmond to paint scenery that they sell all over the world, and not there. The air is better, cleaner. There are four park, swimming beach, one of the best swimming pools, and a golf course that Sausalito and Tiburon do not have! Only the price is lower, but you get so much more, if you care for little fun without the tourists noise!A few minutes drive from Berkeley . . .The unit has good accessibility to the East Bay, San Francisco and the North Bay with minutes to BART Bay Bridge, HWs 80, 580, 101, Richmond/San Rafael Bridge and Richmond Ferry Terminal. There is one park 2 blocks away and additional two parks and a beach for swimming within walking distance (300 yards). The building is surrounded by charming hiking/walking trails with a view of the bay.please watch short videos which gives a little view of the many restaurants, coffee shops, attractions of Point Richmond:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vuS8k_vLZA&list=PLhLAMl2nWuUpPJtPq7Y3an2aW_p1DFrbx&index=28- Please see review of 24 Point Richmond Downtown restaurants on yelp http://www.yelp.com/search?find_desc=Restaurants+Downtown&find_loc=Point+Richmond%2C+CA

description: 1bedroom + 1 bathroom + 1kitchen apartment for $880/month!Room available from late February and lease ends in August, then you can extend the lease for another year. Main bedroom has the size of 15x13 feet. Kitchen, bathroom add up to almost the same area. Four tenants share one big backyard and a small front yard. The back yard has the capacity for parking at least 6 cars. 5 minutes waling distance to Bart Station, 10 minutes driving distance to UC Berkeley, 35 minutes driving distance to downtown SF. One block away from lots of convenience stores like MacDonald, taco bell, gas station etc. Two blocks away from an asian market. 1 block away from a farmers' market that sells fresh veges, eggs meat etc (opens every Friday).Provide some basic furnitures like bed, chairs, desk, microwave etc.Apartment is on the second floor, good view. Safe place, all other tenants in the building are students. Most of them have been renting for years.Tenant pay for utilities, owner pay for the garbage fee.Pets allowed but no smoking, no section 8.The house is open for viewing on Feb 27th (Sat) and Feb28(Sun). To apply, send me an email (my email is xueqilsj AT g_m_a_i_l d_o_t c o m) with short description of your self and make sure you will have following documentations (not required at the moment, but required when sign the contract):1. Proof of income, like bank statement stub or photocopy of paycheck.2. Reference letter or offer letter from your employer. 3. Social security number. 4. If you're an university student or a scholar, please let me know, you may be waived of some documentations.

description: Monthly: $1950/ month- Deposit: $2000Weekly: $550/ week- Deposit: $500Daily: $85/ day- Deposit $100Utilities: All included. WiFi, electric, water, heat and trashFurniture: suitcase/ laptop ready.This is a downstairs 1 bed/ 1 bath unit with a separate entrance. The living room has a large picture window that overlooks the backyard. And has a partial view of the Bay. The unit has a kitchenette that offers a toaster oven, a two burner electric stove top, a microwave oven, a mini fridge with a freezer, a digital coffee maker, a tea pot, a food processor and basic kitchenware for simple everyday cooking. The place also has a full bath with a tub, and a bedroom. The living room has a futon that opens up to be a full bed, & a chaise that opens up to be a twin bed. The bedroom has a comfortable queen bed with a brand new nice mattress, and two large closets. All linens and towels are included.You will have your private separate entrance off of the side of the house. Our washer and dryer are located in the garage, and you will need to coordinate your washing time with us, which won't be hard since one of us works from home and available often.We can interact as much or as little as our guest is comfortable with. We will be more than happy to share our knowledge of the area in which we lived in for years.The house is located on Arlington Boulevard, on the borders between Richmond and El Cerrito. This is a very quiet and nice area, with plenty of street parking. We are close to parks, about a mile away from Wildcat Canyon Park. If you like to walk and/ or bike, this is the place to be.Street parking is available and plentiful.You can continue directly on Arlington Boulevard to Berkeley with no stop lights to avoid traffic in the morning commute hours. We are a walkable 1.2 miles away from El Cerrito del Norte BART station, restaurants & shopping. Safeway is a little over a mile away, there is a convenience store less than 500 feet away from us. Several great restaurants are located within 2 miles from us.Ãœber charges $6 for a ride to and from BART station. We have easy access to Hwy 80 and 580.There is a direct bus (H) that goes from a station four minutes walk from our house to San Francisco downtown.House Rules:No parties, no louds music, and no smoking. We are not providing a TV in order to keep the noise down. If you decided to get a TV, please keep the sound low, or get headphones. Wifi is available for you to replace the TV.Please email us the following info with your inquiry: 1 Full name 2 Why do you need temp housing? 3 If you are an academic, where are you visiting from, and what level are you (undergrad? post-doc? professor?..etc ) 4 If you are employed, what is your job and the name of your company? 5 Specific arrival and departure dates 6 Will you bring a car? 7 Have you visited the Bay Area previously?

description: Premier living in Richmond's Hilltop district San Marcos Apartments in Richmond, California offers convenience so you can focus on fun. Park your vehicle in the comfort of your own private garage, then head inside and spend an evening cozying up next to the fireplace. Whatever your ideal furniture arrangement might be, we offer numerous floor plans in our one- and two-bedroom apartments that are sure to complement your interior design savvy. Controlled, gated access and night patrol means you sleep soundly, and our on-site maintenance team is available 24/7 for all of those "Uh-oh!" moments. Feeling stressed? Take advantage of our fitness center and sports courts for that calorie burn, or stroll down beautifully manicured pathways with your pooch to get some fresh air (yes, of course, these Richmond apartments are pet friendly).Our location in Richmond's Hilltop neighborhood puts you near tons of great places to shop and dine. Head to the Vista del Mar Village Shopping Center to pick up a latte at Starbucks, or shop to your heart's content at the Hilltop Mall, home to staples like Macy's and JC Penny as well as a Wal-Mart. Fresh air abounds at nearby Hilltop Lake Park, and we are also minutes away from the Richmond Country Club and Pointe Pinole Regional Shoreline. Need to get out of Richmond? Hop on I-80 for an easy drive to other cities in the Bay Area. If you don't feel like wasting gas, we are also near bus lines and a few miles from the Richmond Transit Station.Life should be enjoyed, and here at San Marcos Apartments you will have plenty of opportunity to do just that.
title: 3rd Floor Move in ready , Super Specials, Apply Now Online

description: 2 bedroom 2 bath home is located on the 2nd floor and is approx. 1,029 sq. feet.Your new home comes carpeted throughout & fully equipped with:- All major appliances - Stainless steel appliances - Full size washer & dryer w/in the home - Large walk-in closets Enjoy a nice cup of coffee on your private balcony or enjoy the perks of parking with your own private parking garage FREE of charge to you. On-site offers an Olympic style pool & spa, fitness center, two tennis courts & plenty more for your enjoyment. We are located in close proximity to all major highways, shopping centers, grocery store, banks & entertainment. Today this beautiful home is priced at $2,382 for a 13 month lease term and will be available for move in March 6th. CALL OR STOP BY TODAY TO RESERVE YOUR NEW HOME! Prices are subjected to change daily & due to term and dates. Don't miss out on today's pricing.
title: Apartment available for immediate move in

It has a bed, beddings, refrigerator, small kitchen, has cable, washer/dryer on site. It is like an in law cottage on the side of the main house. Walking distance to groceries, restaurants, groceries, businesses. Has parking, large yard for gardening, relaxing and barbecue.Short/long term ok. Near walnut Creek, Pleasant Hill, Clayton, Martinez, Pittsburg, Lafayette, Orinda, Oakland, berkeley.
title: Cozy furnished studio,Concord,walk to BART,Walnut Creek, DVC

description: Great location, friendly quiet neighborhood. Very sharp home! Fantastic open floor plan. Private end unit with 1830 sq. ft. and 4 bedrooms 2.5 bathrooms, large living/dining room combo with fireplace. Spacious kitchen with breakfast nook and all kitchen appliances all 3 years old. Spacious bedrooms with walk in closet and dual sinks inside master bedroom. Downstairs bedroom convenient for guests, in laws, or home office. New paint outside of house, tile floors in kitchen and baths, plush carpet throughout, furnace and garage motor all 3 years old; all new furniture, bed, mattress and window curtains in 3 bedrooms included if desired. Additional, nice landscaped back yard surrounded by beautiful green hillside. Peaceful community close to schools, hospitals (walking just 8 minutes), grocery, and downtown (15 minutes). Bus (West-cat) to Bart, driving South to Berkeley University only 10 minutes.*Furniture is optional*Absolutely no petsText Angela for showing times.Tenant responsible for water, PGE, and trash (trash is $32/month)Sorry no pets.
title: Quiet Neighborhood 4Bed End Unit TH + Yard

description: Available in May 2016 - 1,002 ft2 Artist live work space, for one or two persons. The prohibition era Milano Hotel now an artist work space building in the C&H sugar factory small town community of Crockett. Located near to I-80 and the Carquinez Bridge.Work space consist of: 9' high ceiling 540 sq ft red concrete floor studio ideal for a photographer or artist not requiring sunlight. Kitchen, bathroom, living room and bedroom, five windows and wood floors in living areas.Street access to deli, bars, galleries, fish restaurants, convenience store within a short walk. Port Costa and Bull Valley restaurant just ten minute drive along the Strait. Bus connection with BART but vehicular transport best. This last two years Crockett art community has hosted an Open Studio weekend in November, thirty artist have been involved. The community has a small town feel about it although it's just fifteen minutes from Berkeley and thirty five from SF. Interested, come take a look, email you contact information and artist website url.Milano Gallery at 706 2nd Ave. open Saturday and Sunday midday to 5 pm come by ask to look at the live work space.www.milanoarts.com
title: Artist Live Work space in Crockett

description: Crockett is a safe, friendly, small town, with a well-established artist's community. Nestled in green hills on the banks of the Carquinez Straits you have easy access to I-80; non commute time it takes just 15 minutes to Berkeley or BART. Or catch the ferry in Vallejo to San Francisco, 5 minutes away over the Carquinez Bridge.This one bedroom apartment (top left) has a wonderful water view; and is available now. It is one of three self-contained apartments in this genuine Cape Cod building with a private entrance via an external flight of stairs. Behind the building there's a large un-fenced garden available for tenants (if you love gardening, and want to grow your own veggies, this is the place for you)! The apartment has brand new carpet and freshly painted throughout. Natural gas heating and cooking. The bedroom looks out on the garden and has a small built in closet. The bathroom has a claw foot tub and shower combo. There's a small breakfast bar in the kitchen. The living room has full water view; a small storage room; and an alcove wired for internet, ideal for laptop home office set up. All this adds up to 650 sq. ft. of sunny space in total.We are looking for a mature, long term tenant to make this home. Someone with good rental references. A non-smoker and pet free person who will fit in well with our existing tenants who are respectful professionals; responsible, quiet and easy going. Rent is $1,450 per month. Deposit is $1,450. Total move in cost is $2,900 (deposit and first month's rent). A non-refundable application processing fee of $35 is payable at the time of submitting your completed and signed application. We ask you to bring a CA ID and proof of income at this time also. Email Lindsay with your contact phone number for more details and arrange a viewing.
title: Great Water View from Crockett Apartment

description: Clean, elegant Victorian flat in Vallejo's Heritage district. All rooms full of charm and Victorian detail: Laminate flooring, ornate molding, pedestal sink, and ceramic tiling. Well-lit kitchen with antique Wedgewood stoveHuge back yardWasher and dryer in unit One and a half bathroomsComputer room or OfficeLarge garage great for storageDimensions: Living room 11 x 11. Kitchen 10 x 15. Large bedroom 13 x 11. Small bedroom 10 x 10. Computer room 5 x 5. Total 625 sq. ft. Located in safe, quiet neighborhood with overgrown gardens and friendly neighbors. Walk to downtown (farmers market every Saturday) and ferry (a relaxing 60 minutes to San Francisco), waterfront parks, restaurants, banks, library, coffee shops and the newly opened historic Empress Theatre. Centrally located to Wednesday Night Celebrations, bus station, shopping, dining--all at the heart of the best Vallejo has to offer. Drive by property at 926 - 928 Virginia Street. Apartment located in three-unit building. Owner pays water. Respond to this email or call Tom atNearby Cities: American Canyon, Benicia, Napa, Berkeley, Los Cerritos, Martinez.Tenant must have -good credit (above 640-contact info for current employer-contact info for current landlord
title: Victorian Apartment in Vallejo's Safest Neighborhood

description: If you work, teach or study at Cal Berkeley or UC Davis, you should really consider the Mediterranean Village Apartments. Our stunningly beautiful (yet affordable) is about 30 miles from both campuses. We know that the board or regents is squeezing your paychecks and your tuition.They're upscale homes, well appointed with wood burning fireplaces and spacious floor plans. The manicured common area includes a sparkling pool, heated spa, and clubhouse. There are also 2 onsite laundry facilities.Conveniently close to the I-80 freeway, good neighbors, attentive management and close to schools and shopping. Just look at the photos on your website and you won't need a PhD to see what and incredible deal you're getting.Make the educated decision and call us to learn more about your new home
title: Do you work at Cal Berkeley or UC Davis?

description: Welcome To HigbyBuilt In 2015.A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest BerkeleyModern building amenities include: â€¢	Lobby with lounge seating and TVâ€¢	Courtyard with a bocce ball courtâ€¢	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city viewsâ€¢	Fitness studioâ€¢	Indoor bike storage and work standâ€¢	Enclosed residential parking garageApartment units feature: â€¢	Electric ovensâ€¢	Gas range cooktopsâ€¢	Dishwashersâ€¢	Washers and dryersHigby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:â€¢	Locally sourced and recycle content materialsâ€¢	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning programâ€¢	Aggressive construction waste recycling programâ€¢	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumptionâ€¢	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.Office HoursMonday 9am - 6pmTuesday 9am - 6pmWednesday 9am - 6pmThursday 9am - 6pmFriday 9am - 6pmSaturday 10am - 5pmSunday 10am - 5pm3015 SAN PABLO AVE, Berkeley, CA 94702www.livehigby.com
title: Highy- Live More Green & Feel Much Better
